Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business travelers staying in LA.”
Reviews.Author: amacwow
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and very close to airport. Staff is more than helpful in most situations. Restaurant is fine, but I would suggest eating out for breakfast as their breakfast menu is extremely high priced. $28 for two and one of us only had toast and juice. Their lunch and dinners are more in line with what cost should be. Overall a good experience and I have been staying there for years. As holiday Inn advises..... No surprises.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: robinhenshaw
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for LAX (free shuttle). New very large hotel. The staff try their best but it's very impersonal. Good restaurant, excellent breakfast, nice little bar. Room fine. Quite good deal on LA tour from consierge. Small pool (did not use). No grounds - hotel entrance rather squeezed in among existing businesses. But reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Value, convenient, but ...”
Reviews.Author: zorro-plata
Reviews.Content: The thing I like most about Holiday Inn LAX is the proximity to Pepe's Tacos in Inglewood. I'm not kidding. A 10 minute walk along W Century Blvd to Inglewood gets you some of the best tacos you can eat, not to mention a mean menudo and fabulous burrito. The walk takes you under the freeway where lots of homeless hang out, so I'm not recommending the walk at night. And the hotel itself -- it's OK. Actually it's quite good. Nice decor, reasonably priced, a bit stinky in the lobby but helpful staff, free shuttle to/from LAX, and the rooms are clean -- except, my buddy who stayed in the room across from me got insect bites all over his leg in the one night we were there. He says it was mosquitoes, but I don't think so (windows can't open). Maybe the dreaded bed bugs? Or fleas?

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: judystoks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before taking a cruise. Joe was outstanding!! He got us hooked up with transportation to the port for an excellent price. And he got us a limo!! The front desk was efficient and friendly at check-in. The room was nice and clean. The only thing that I would have to complain about is the towels. They were stiff. Other than that we had a great stay and I would book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Qwik16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just minutes away from LAX with a convenient shuttle. The staff was friendly and check-in easy. The room was large and recently renovated with stylish drapes and wallpaper. The flatscreen TV had great reception and good recent movie selections. I did not like the squishiness of the foam top on the mattress, which was adequately firm in its base, nor did I like the lack of choice in pillows. The door to the hallway is not sound-proof so you have to put up with hearing slamming of doors throughout the night. There is a $16.00 charge for parking, but the lot and garage seem very safe in an area that is a little sketchy. I would stay here again if I had to catch an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Airline Crew”
Reviews.Author: travelermanPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a lot. The staff is nice & helpful but the rooms are a hit & miss. This time I was very disappointed in the room 1003 holes in bed sheets, AC controlo panel not working on wall.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: TXJones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for a one night stay close to the airport. They charge $15 for parking. The two bed rooms are double beds not queen. The room smelled musty and the toilet seat still had urine stains and hair in it from the last guest. The service was good and it was fine for one night.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franklin J
Reviews.Content: I've been trying to call the hotel for the past 3 hours, calling every 5-10mins...i've been trying to contact a hotel guest and all the phone does is ring ring ring. i called both the 800 and 310 number, same thing. Spend 30mins waitng for the holiday inn customer service and all they said was to keep on trying. My parents have a flight in the morning and i've been trying to call them. Last nite when i called, it went thru an automated system with options, today, nothing. This is ridiculous and i will never give another $$$$ to holiday inn...this is horrible service, i rather pay more money to stay elsewhere then this.

Reviews.Title: “Airline Crew”
Reviews.Author: winkrob92
Reviews.Content: It's a hit &the miss one week go od another bad. If you go outside hotel don't go to your left not safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but great for LAX flights”
Reviews.Author: JubilantBeggar
Reviews.Content: Marginal hotel, but close in proximity to LAX. When I showed up on a Thursday night, there was a line out the door to check-in. Nothing like being greeted by total craziness...kids were running around, luggage was strewn all over the lobby, and the staff was checking in people at a very slow rate. After about 20 minutes in line, I received my keys to the room. To my surprise, the room appeared to be recently remodeled to cater towards the chic look. However, you would not know that by walking down the hallways (hallway was banged up and looked aged). They did offer a passcode for free wifi, but it was late and I was hitting the sack, so I turned down the wifi access code (free wi-fi is always a plus). I woke up at 2am in the morning due to some retarded couple that decided to get in a yelling match. They must have been drunk because they went on and on and on--I eventually got out of bed at 3:30am and they were still gong at it. Apparently, the hotel staff was unable to get them to shut up. It would have been nice if the walls were thicker to muffle the noise of rude guests, but what are you going to do? That being said, you can not knock a hotel for the actions of other rude guests. I would have gladly rated the hotel higher if they did not charge $15 for parking and if they offered a complementary breakfast. However, since that was not a case, 3 stars for you, Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Joe you make this Hotel !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lw080212
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as we transited to & from NYC.... We chose this hotel from this website on it's positive reviews . As the hotel is pretty much just a airport hotel , why we would stay there again is the wonderful man in the front office Joe , what a treasure he is to your business. We had our 11 month old son with us & he made sure our check in was speedy , as we had just arrived from Australia & he could see we were tired . Another positive , they were very accomadating of our early arrival , as we had a 10 am check in & we arrived at 0700. For our return back to LA we hadn't booked the hotel & it was only that Joe was so great , that we chose the holiday inn again & as soon as he saw us get off the transit bus he called my husband by name. WOW. So if it's location to the airport & good old personal service .... Look no further ..... Transit bus is so handy as well ..... Thanks Lisa . Brisbane Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to the airport but far from town”
Reviews.Author: maxi_bon2011
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel for a quick stopover as it's close to the airport and there's a convenient shuttle service door to door. Don't stay here if you're in town for a while though, it's pretty far from anything and LA is not an easy city to get around. I had to catch a few buses and managed to get lost just trying to get downtown and back. The staff weren't particularly helpful on this point. I'd suggest doing some research into the location before you get there. There was a nice, easy trolley service to Manhattan Beach though. You can buy tickets for this in the lobby - it was only $5. The room was nice enough, big bed, choice of pillows. Bathroom could have been better lit but otherwise alright. Overall a decent stay, I just wish I had researched the location a bit more before I got there and realised I was stuck pretty far from anything!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a night close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: alanadi25
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy, our room was big and very clean. Toilet was sort of a bit hard to flush and the bathroom was quite small. We liked the room decor and we took advantage of their room service menu, the food was quite good and it was very convenient for us. Parking was a bit steep- $15 for the night but we expected that. Would be happy to stay here again and would recommend to anyone needing a room close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “DATED WITH AVERAGE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: lillypilly72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to flying back to Australia. It is quite old and dated property, the barhroom is miniscule withe the bath over the shower inadequate. I wanted a shower but it kept going from cold to hot every 20 or so seconds, no consistency. There were stains on the sheets and a terrible smell in the hallways. There is one restaurant in the hotel which i did not eat at as the prices were ridiculous for what you got, considering Mc Donalds was next door for a quarter of the price.What was really dissapointing was our flight back to Australia was 11.30pm the following night, and i asked for a later checkout if possible, they said yes but for 5 extra hours it would be $69.00 plus tax, even though i prepaid the whole night for $104.00. This to me is price gouging and i think they like taking advantage of this. I had my wife and 8 year old son, what was i suppose to do, hang out at Lax for 11 hours. This was the first time at this hotel and it will certainly be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Great 'stop over' hotel with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Janieg9
Reviews.Content: Concierge and staff were very friendly, room was clean and tidy. There is a Macdonalds very close by and they can organise tours into LA - which we did and as there were only four other people on the bus it was great. Its a long way from LA - a $50/$60 taxi ride but close enough to the airport and the free shuttle is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “An uneasy but OK stay...”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: Even as I write this I find it hard to describe the feeling I had staying at this property. The building is jammed between other buildings as if the owners sold off surrounding land leaving only ring of parking around the main building. Tucked behind another building, a McDonaldâ€™s, and a service station the property can be easily missed. Lighting outside the property, while adequate, is not bright. The lobby is well lit and seems to be recently remodeled. Staff recognized me in a proper manner and upgraded me to the â€œExecutiveâ€� floor on 11. Once you leave the lobby through the layout you sense how dated this property is. There is a lounge/bar area which seems like an afterthought. The room is disjointed and uncomfortable and must be navigated to get to the on-site restaurant. There is also a little convenience store on sight that charges double the going rates. Moving from the lobby to the guest area was like be transported in a time portal. The guest level hallways are dimly lit and eerily quiet and you can tell doors and jambs have been repainted many times with no attention to detail. My room looked to be remodeled with vintage Holiday Inn artwork on the walls. Good sized flat screen TV, small fridge, and the newer other appointments. Internet worked well. Bed was very comfortable and the linens were fresh. The bathroom was clean with fresh good sized towels and all the fixtures worked great. Shower had great pressure and plenty of hot waterâ€¦always a plus. There is some road/airport noise but I think that is unavoidable near LAX. Huge plus is the shuttle service which runs to LAX every 15-20 minutes, which was my main reason for staying at this property due to my very early flight. Overall a good stay. If you are looking for a reliable shuttle, and economical rate, and not too concerned with amenities this property fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Early Wake-Ups!”
Reviews.Author: Mimielephant
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an average experience at this hotel. It was nothing special and possibly a bit overpriced. The one thing that I found a bit irritating was the early maid wake-up. On the day of check-out, we were awoke at 8am by a maid attempting to come in our room. I just can't understand this! So, if you stay here-make sure you put up a do not disturb sign!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekers
Reviews.Content: My wife is an airline employee so we fly standby. This can mean not getting on flights. During the holidays we were stuck at LAX for two days. After day one and the airline sending our luggage on to our final destination, with a 2 year old in tow. The hotel shuttle driver was so nice to run us by a store so we could pick up some emergency items to get us through another night. As for the hotel. Great location, nice rooms, clean, awesome free shuttle service to and from LAX. Would definitely recommend this hotel overnights in or out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTash
Reviews.Content: After missing a flight, I had to find accomodation at midnight. I started ringing around and the person who answered at Holiday Inn was most helpful and gave me the best rate - so I booked and caught the free shuttle over. It was about 1am by the time we got up to the room. The lobby and hallways are bright and well maintained.. but the room we had was quite dated and in need of renovation. The room was clean, but the beds were small doubles and the linen was quite thin. Air Conditioner was tricky. View from windows in the morning are of the airport - my son was entertained watching all the planes coming in to land. One thing I really disliked was the ventilation was terrible in the bathroom and after I had my shower .. the ceiling continued to drip on me from the condensation. Yuck! The staff were great re: storing our bags after check out. Special mention to Joe who was very helpful re: suggestions for places to go that day before our flight. The hotel served its purpose, was reasonably priced and was convenient to the airport with the free shuttle. I probably wouldnt stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DalisuDube
Reviews.Content: Great Service. Rooms are very nice.Close to LA int Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_H777
Reviews.Content: We recently(20 Dec 2011) stayed for a night before making the la to vegas road trip. Booked the hotel last minute and was very happy with all aspects of the experience. Location is great very close to airport, car hire and has a McDonalds and taco bell within walking distance for the quick and nasty take out fix. Our package included breakfast and parking. Above all the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for layovers”
Reviews.Author: Karleewdwicp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the holiday inn at lax airport. We had not booked a room, just for the reason because that we only wanted a half day rate. We checked in went up to the room. I personally love the holiday inn's just because the rooms are larger than most. We had lunch the service was slow but we were not in a rush I also feel sorry for the gentleman that was working all on his lonesome. We then had a sleep. Had a shower. Used the free wifi to Skype Australia and then caught the free shuttle bus back to the airport to board our next flight. Now it is close to the airport so you may hear them fly by (well der) but to be honest the window glass is thick as and I could hear a thing. I can't fault this hotel. Pictures below

Reviews.Title: “bell man is dodgy”
Reviews.Author: Riclau
Reviews.Content: we came back to la to see a sport game and asked for advise to get to the center the shuttle driver has helpful and said a taxi would be a flat fare of $50 one way so when we got out of the bus i asked the bell man to get a taxi as there is no visible taxi rank, we had to go and check in and get dressed, in that time he called us in our room and said instead of the taxi he had organized a private driver to take us and bring us back. at the same rate. i dont think "private service" means going down to the basement level and out the back door alley looking area to meet the ex-car salesman pushiest schemer driver of the year. we probably could have bailed out but really needed to get to the game after a delayed flight. 100 bucks turned into 140.. and we got told we couldnt pay by card without a 20% surcharge. what a load. i realise we could have possibly found another way but with 20,000 people leaving a venue we just paid the money to make sure we got back and they knew how to play on that fact. good for them. we wont be making the same mistake again. otherwise the bed was good quality the food was good. and free wifi which helps.

Reviews.Title: “It sucks! Never stay here one more time!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy8527
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here. One was loud and noisy at the end of the hallway where the ice machine makes ice with huge noise next to us. The other one doesn't have a working air conditioning. Both toilets are not working properly. We had to replace one and the other one just doesn't flush the crap down! The staff doesn't care at all!!!!!!!!!!! The front desk staff just ignored my complaint and the housekeeping staff doesnt refresh the toiletry! Dont ever ever stay here! There are plenty of other hotels around the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ozziegirlz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose to stay here overnight before catching a flight to New Orleans. The staff were incredibly friendly, no problems with an early check in (which we appreciated since we had just flown in from Australia!). The shuttle pick up at the airport was easy to find and we didn't have to wait long for the it. The room itself was very comfortable. Probably the only thing I wasn't 100% happy with was that there was hardly any room on the basin counter top to put our toiletries. Check out was quick the next day and once again we didn't have to wait long for the shuttle to take us back to the airport. I will definitely stay here again. Oh, and there was also a couple of eateries within walking distance if you didn't want to eat on site. We had lunch and breakfast on site and the food was very nice. Staff service was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight for an early flight!”
Reviews.Author: dkcoll
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we had an early flight to catch & we are priority club members. As a platinum member we are meant to be upgraded. upon check in we were greeted with an unfriendly male who would not even make eye contact with us & said the hotel did not upgrade & then when we asked for details about transfers to the airport we got one worded answers. When we checked out another male staff member on front desk only mumbled when we asked about a receipt & he said no to us!!! Funny we are now at the Holiday Inn in Washington & got an upgrade no questions asked & a heck of a lot more courteous & helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Service has gone down the tubes!”
Reviews.Author: CherylandBrett
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here for 20 years because we fly out of LAX. This had been our favorite hotel but this last visit was really poor! NO hair dryer in the room! No nut/chex mix given with drinks, no voucher for $20 off food when we park our car for 2 weeks. NOTHING anymore! The room was small and bathroom tiny. We have been Priority Club members for years and years but never again do we plan to stay at this hotel. No service, no customers! No free newspaper anymore either!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable quality accommodation”
Reviews.Author: kiwi2403
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel quite a lot of times when we travel through to London and break the trip up for a night in Los Angeles. We have found it to be reasonably priced, it is always clean and check in has always been efficient. The rooms have all been refurbished in the past 12 months. The only down side is the $15.00 parking fee but due to the proximity to the airport, it is to be expected. As we are travelling with children, the McDonalds next door is very handy and the service station has a shop. Over all we have never had a problem here.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo_Bruce
Reviews.Content: Nice property next to LAX. Recently updated. Must be a good place to work, one employee I spoke with said this was the 5th renovation in 30 years. He said he knew because he started working there 30 years ago. Now thatâ€™s good management. Service was very good. Asked at every turn if my stay was pleasant and if there was anything I needed. Went looking for my USA today at my door and upon not finding it asked the Concierge on my way to breakfast, he said they didnâ€™t get read, but he had one for me and any guest that asks. I chose this property this time because I could walk back from the Thrifty car rental office just two blocks down century boulevard. This area is safe as long as you stay on the main streets. Save some money and return the car the night before. Take the free hotel shuttle to the airport. I stay at the Holiday Inn Express just north of the airport when I rent from Enterprise for the same reason. Breakfast was nothing special, but all the buffet food was hot, and the service attentive. Coffee came quick and even was asked if I wanted a cup to-go. Nice touch. This is an acceptable hotel for something near the airport. The surrounding area has little to offer as amenities, and those looking for a home base to explore LA should stay elsewhere, The traffic on the 405 near the airport is legendary.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for price”
Reviews.Author: status88
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights for a business trip. The hotel condition was so-so, I tried 3 icemakers before I found one working, hallways were musty. The room itself was nicely decorated, spacious, and the bed comfortable and clean. Had an HDTV and internet speeds were good. Overall pretty quiet, occasional traffic noise, planes weren't noticed. Shower curtain needed replacing. However for the price I got on travelocity secret hotels it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “watch for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this property with incorrect charges so beware. Good luck trying to correct them once you check out, cannot understand any of the names in accounting..might need to speak Spanish to communicate with the accounting staff. Check your bill before you leave......

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN MOST AIRPORT HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: PAULWOODS1
Reviews.Content: I do not expect much from airport hotels - they tend to be flop houses where people crash in at all hours of the day and night. They tend to stay next door and let the doors bang without a thought. This hotel was comfortable, quiet and reasonably priced. It is very close to the airport and I would say that it is far enough away so that it is not too noisy.I did not use the Shuttle as we had a rent-a car. Early morning wake up worked and the bed was very comfortable. We ate at the restaurant and whilst I would not describe this as a Gastronomic Experience it was perfectly acceptable - there seems to be little else nearby. What it lacked was the seedy flop house feel that so many airport hotels seem to have. As a start to a trip or the end - it was as good as these places get.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: Galena11
Reviews.Content: I had to book a one-night stay in LA unexpectedly, and was looking for a hotel that was: near the airport, at a decent price, and was safe for a woman traveling alone. The Holiday Inn delivered on all of those requirements. The front desk staff was lovely, the room was nicely appointed for the price, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only downside was that housekeeping repeatedly knocked on my door starting at 7:00 AM, despite having the privacy request card on the door. When I notified the desk of this as I checked out, they waived the parking fee (which, at $15, is a bit steep) and apologized profusely.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice this summer and both times the room had the scent of too much carpet deodorizor. I bidded for the room and 'won' a $55 daily rate but didn't know that there was a $15 daily parking fee! What I didn't like, not only here but at most hotels, is having to walk through a haze of smokers smoke to enter/exit the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quaint location”
Reviews.Author: NovemberRain80
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very neat and lives up to the usual Holiday inn standard. Room was very clean with an LCD tv. The only gripe i have is that i wad unable to use my IPhone charger in the socket that is on the bedside lamp. No extra benefits as a PC platinum which is fine because i was on an award stay. Would defintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50plustropicallover
Reviews.Content: After reading earlier reviews I was a little worried I had booked this hotel, however I found the concierge to be extremely friendly and helpful. Checkin was easy, our room was spacious, quiet, clean and comfortable. The free internet was a bonus and the shuttle was reliable and made travel to and from the airport easy. We used this hotel at the beginning and end of our holiday. We chose this hotel as it was convenient to the airport, had a free shuttle service and was reasonably priced. The concierge helped us out with buses to use for travel to the beach areas and rang the VIP tour company to book tours for us. Macdonalds is directly in front if you want a cheap, convenient meal and there is a small convenience store next door. This hotel is convenient to the airport, but not to downtown or Hollywood attractions, unless you take an organised tour or public transport.

Reviews.Title: “nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCMark
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive checking in due to some negative reviews but I was unable to find any issues that were noted in some reviews. Check in went well and staff was courteous. Room was spacious enough with a flat screen tv, refrig, and pod coffee maker. The hotel was well kept with a decent little sports lounge and restaurant on site. It had a little gift shop as well. There is a McDonald's right next to the property and an AM/PM as well, both of which you can get to very quickly without crossing any streets or dealing with traffic. Not a ton of TV stations if you are a TV buff. My only real complaint would be that there were no towels available in the fitness center. For the price and location I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Latrice H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I have no complaints. The room was clean. Beds were super comfortable. Housekeeping came whenever needed. And with it being right near the airport, it was surprisingly not loud AT ALL. It was actually pretty cool to be able to see the planes landing. Bonus... there is a McDonald's right in front of the hotel (much better than paying for the expensive breakfast in the hotel). Overall, I'd recommend staying at Holiday Inn LAX. Although, I would NOT recommend eating the hotel food. Way overpriced and not very tastey at all.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: TexasRR
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy hotel to get to with a forced overnight on my way back from Asia. This Holiday Inn was easy to get to after waiting about 15 minutes for the shuttle. Make sure to be watching for the shuttle, especially if you arrive at night and there are tons of people trying to get to their hotels. Driver was ok...a little bossy but understandable considering the time of day. After arriving at the hotel I was able to check in easily. The room was clean, AC nice and cool and I had no real issues during my stay there. There is a McDonald's right next to the hotel and I think it is 24 hours. If you need an easy and safe place to get to if you have to overnight, then I highly recommend this Holiday Inn. I will probably stay again my next time through.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport stay option”
Reviews.Author: jmannz
Reviews.Content: These rooms are very large we were lucky enough to get upgraded to an excutive room on the top floor.Have stayed here twice now and find them to be very good.Getting here from the airport is easy go outside and wait on the holiday inn bus wave it down and they take you direct to the hotel I think it runs every 15 mins or so. Had breakfast they charge 15 dollars for the buffet ( from memory) It was ok had better and had worse unfortunatly we found some expired milk in a carton which was off Told the staff got an apology but that was it! Apart from that we would reccommend this property to others There is a Mcdonalds right beside the hotel if you get caught short.

Reviews.Title: “Where's my perks?”
Reviews.Author: TSExpert
Reviews.Content: Second stay here and again more priority club issues. I was told there was water in the suite, and I was happy to here that because it was midnight and I was tired and thirsty when I checked in. No water in the room. Every other HI property I stay in, there is a newspaper waiting for me at the door in the morning. No paper. Room was very nice, bed a bit soft. Shuttle was timely and courteous. No snack machines, you have to leave the property and go to a sleezy circle K next door for that. Last time I was there the computers did not work, this time I never tried.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay for one night, but...”
Reviews.Author: nata2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only one night, and it is close to the airport and convenient for this purpose. The room was pretty big and upgraded ( granite in the bathroom and flat screen TV but no refrigerator which we would appreciate). What I did not like: we asked for two beds instead of one king size because we had a daughter with us, but it was $20 more expensive (usually it's the same price). Also, we had to pay $15 for a parking space, which is usually complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oside_Scott
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst Holiday Inn hotel experience I have had. The hotel was not clean, in poor repair, gang graffiti all over the stairwells, ice machines out of order, lack of security and had no customer service. Upon arrival, our room had only one towel set and no iron. We called housekeeping and requested another set of towels which were delivered, but never got an iron after 2 request.The hotel also offered pillow choices, we requested meduim down pillows 3 times and never got them, just an extra pillow case. Our telivision did not work, they sent maintnence right up and he looked at it and said he had to go down stairs for a minute and never returned. We called again about the tv and never got another response to this request. The hotel restuarant was out of more menu choices than they had. They charged 15 a day for parking. We actually left on Saturday and forfieted our last night due to the disapointment of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, brand continues to disappoint me”
Reviews.Author: slj_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a lay over from NY to Thailand, the whole stay was pretty disappointing on the service front and the property itself was really pretty bog standard. Tried to use the pool early the first morning but apart from the discarded dirty towels littering the place there were none around, a quick toe in the water completed the dissuasion. I returned at lunch time towel in hand for a quick dip and by that stage things were set up in a more orderly fashion. If the pool is a big seller for you please note the following; the pool is at the side of the building and is surrounded by a large wall, while this allows a fair degree of privacy it also effectively leaves the pool in the shade for most of the day - hence it's freezing cold. More critically access to the pool means leaving and reentering the hotel through the lobby of the hotel itself. Pictures of the pool also exaggerate it's size. In my opinion the pool is there as a box ticker rather than an integral part of the offering, i felt suckered by it and I didn't have grandiose expectations to start with! Checking in at 2am in the morning took an unnecessarily long time, when presenting my gold rewards card I was told there was no need as I wouldn't be getting any points as I'd booked with Hotel.com - a lesson learned, unfortunately for Holiday Inn given the recent experiences I've had my takeaway is to stick with Hotels.com/Tripadvisor and give holiday Inn the swerve! Tried for a late check out the following day as my flight wasn't until 11.00pm but the best they would give me was 2.00pm (initially they had offered 1pm but I talked them up, whoopee!!). As a result I had to leave my luggage with the concierge, which again took some negotiating - apparently his cupboard was full and he only relented when he saw the seriously pissed off look come over my face when i pushed the matter further. Clearly they must be doing something right as the hotel was patently busy; i suspect that the proximity to LAX, free shuttle bus and the halo (seriously fractured imo) of the Holiday Inn brand was what clinched the deal as I personally couldn't find any other redeeming features...

Reviews.Title: “Really, really bad.”
Reviews.Author: KrisInOakland
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late after an 8 hour drive, and intended to sleep in. I awoke to hammering and called the front desk. They were not aware of any construction going on and said they would send someone up to check on the floor above us. No return call, the hammering didn't stop, so I called back again. Same thing, no one had any idea, said they would call around. A third call when the hammering continued, and they contacted housekeeping to confirm that yes, construction was happening on floors 3-8. How does the front desk not know about this? Why wouldn't they be informed, and warn guests about it? And why not call back instead of making me call repeatedly? It's as incomprehensible as it is bad business. Finally we were transfered to a room on the ninth floor. No noise, but the toilet would not flush. We left at 1 pm to go to my high school reunion, and the front desk said they would have someone come and fix the toilet. When we returned at 1 am, the toilet would still not flush (still contained waste from the morning - ugh). I called the manager and we were moved to a very noisy room right behind the elevators, and given vouchers for $7 each for breakfast (room service not allowed). This is the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The worst part was the apathy exhibited by the staff. They just didn't care at all, and it showed.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have a connecting flight or a car”
Reviews.Author: alejosinde
Reviews.Content: Despite the location, 10 minutes from LAX, the hotel is not as noisy as you probably expect. Room's size is great with high ceilings however some of the baths are a bit old. Parking is not really expensive 15$ per night however getting a parking lot if you arrive late could be a pure adventure... As Priority club Platinum member you get free parking or free breakfast, as well you get a 15% discount in bars/restaurants of the hotel. Bar prices are really Ok however in the restaurant the service is quite slow. There is a shared shuttle service (with la quinta suites) to the airport, it works well however there is not a fixed schedule, so allow 10 to 20 minutes wait to be on the safe mode. I f you don't have a car there is really nothing to do around the hotel and connections to any other place are not really easy and very time consuming. If you have a car hotel location is really good to any visit in LA and much more affordable that other locations. Quality of Internet connection could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: L8ON
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Airport Los Angeles met our expectations. The price was right and the accommodation was clean and comfortable. Staff were pleasant and helpful and meals were adequate and not expensive. A good stopover hotel. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: tatty21
Reviews.Content: Ok so I wrote a review about staying at a off-brand hotel, encouraging people to stay at "name-brand" hotels, because of the list of bad experiences I had endured. Well, forget it... this hotel was DIRTY, SMELLY and just downright NASTY! My son had to pay $15.00 to park the car in an unsecured area. His car contained all his worldly possessions. When I arrived at LAX I was told to wait and the shuttle bus would pick me up, they did not tell me where to wait. After 30mins I called back only to be told the bus runs every 20 mins, and I missed it because I was not waiting in the RED area. Got to the hotel, was able to just walk into the room that my son was in, because the lock was broken, and there was no chain. Pulled back the covers on my bed... and the sheets had been slept in, and not by my son. DISGUSTING. The towels in the bathroom were a dingy white, that even bleach would not help. Never will I stay here again. I don't want to sound prejudice here, as I happen to love the Indian people. But everytime I stay in a hotel where the management/owners are of Indian origin/descent the places are sub-par

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at LAX”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryMM
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Holiday Inn, La Cienega Boulevard, LAX on 2 separate occasions during a trip to the United States in May/June this year. The rooms were spacious , nicely furnished and the beds very comfortable. The 24 hour and regular free shuttle service to and from the airport was a bonus. The small shop, just off from the reception area, was stocked with many immediate requirements and the restaurant in the complex offered a varied and pleasant menu. If hunger pangs are too great outside of restaurant hours, a McDonalds is just outside the main entrance of the hotel. As an overnight stop-over between flights this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: jenmc8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to taking a flight out of LAX. We made our reservations a week before, so we were fortunate to get a room. When we checked in, they upgraded our room to an Executive room. It was perfect for our overnight needs with the highlight of a mini fridge. The shuttle service to LAX ran every 15 to 20 minutes, was on time and the drivers were courteous! The only concern I had with the room was the lack of a ventilation fan in the bathroom. Other than that it was clean and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean_0707
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our last day of a seven day tour of California. We picked this hotel because of the proximity to the airport and did not want to deal with traffic before our flight. We checked in early evening. My initial impression of this hotel was it was a very nice hotel. Lobby seemed nice and so did our room when we first walked in. We dropped off our luggage and headed down to the hotel resturant which was ok. When we returned to our room, I went to wash my face and discovered there were no washcloths. I also went to use the toliet and noticed that the toliet seat had brown liquid looking stains on the seat. Gross! I called the front desk to tell them that I needed wash cloths and the toliet was disgusting. They sent someone to bring me washcloths but they took off without cleaning the toliet. I called the front desk again about the toliet. 40 minutes later, no one had come to clean the toliet. I called again and finally said forget it, I wiped it myself. I asked to speak with a manager and told her about the nasty toliet, having to wait 40+ minutes for someone who never came. I told her I finally cleaned it because - #1 - I needed to pee and #2 - my husband wanted to take a shower since we had driven 6 hours that day, we were tired and wanted to go to bed. I also told her there was hair on both pillow cases and the pillow cases were either stained or dirty. While I was on the phone with the manager, someone finally showed up. He proceeded to wipe down the toliet with a damp washcloth. My question is, if something looks like fecal matter on the toliet, don't you use a disinfectant or something other than a damp washcloth? It only got worse. The washcloths that were brought to me still looked dirty, as did the hand towels. I informed the manager of this as well. The shower curtain was so beat up it was literally hanging on by a thread. The tub had paint chips, which are sharp by the way. The windows were so incredibly filthy, I could barely see out of them. Most of the parking spots were for compact cars. I watched two cars spend 15 minutes trying to park in the tiny spaces. This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had and I have traveled a lot. I have never actually even had a complaint about a hotel's cleaniness. I spent seven nights, staying in seven different hotels throughout California last week and the only two hotels that were digusting were Holiday Inns. I am very disappointed in this hotel chain. Their slogan is "Book with Confidence" We make it right or you don't pay. Nothing was ever made right for us. I just got an apology from the manager stating that the room should not have been in that condition when I checked in. Really? It shouldn't have been when I checked out either. I thought they were better than that. I didn't have a problem with Holiday Inns before, but I will never stay at one again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: phyozo
Reviews.Content: Here are some things they don't tell you about this hote when you book: 1) Terrible service - the worst aspect of this stay. I asked for ear plugs because the walls were so thin and my neighbors were being loud. The lady at the front hung up on me instead of acknowledging my request. After I asked to speak with someone else, I was told the hotel does not carry ear plugs and that nothing could be done about the loud noise. 2) Poor room quality - overpowering citrus smell will fill your nose when you enter the room, likely to cover up the smell of carpets and sheets of questionable cleanliness. The door to the bathroom was jammed and could not be closed properly. The bathroom walls had moldy corners. The hanger off the door was broken and could not be used. 3) Terrible location - very shady neighborhood in the middle of an industrial area; feels unsafe to walk outside even in the daytime 4) Parking - $15 for a night in the hotel's closed lot. If you don't want in-out priviledges, then you can park across the street for $6.95 everytime you want to leave. Terrible. I will never return and will tell others not to come here!

Reviews.Title: “It does not deserve 3-stars at all !!”
Reviews.Author: tk0410
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the airport but lacks modern amenities. Rooms are very old with dirty carpet and some strange smell. Parking is $15 while there is ample public parking on the street right behind it (No Parking on Thursdays from Noon to 2 PM due to street cleaning). At nights they hardly had any parking available for the guests, I had to park outside on the street. I don't understand how Hotwire rated this hotel as a 3-star hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of quoted prices”
Reviews.Author: malrose13
Reviews.Content: We were horrified to find we were duped into staying at this hotel. The price quoted was not the price charged. the breakfast quoted as free breakfast was in fact a voucher of such a small amount it hardly purchased anything for our family. The staff were rude and un-interested in the quote vs the reality. Please ask for a fax or email in writing quoting exactly what will be provided.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel, poor customer service, excellent restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: Christopher-Bean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located near LAX, 15 minutes away via the free shuttle. I would rate this as a 3 staff hotel, rooms are acceptable and staff in the restaurant are excellent. The front desk staff are not overly helpful and seem more interested in getting you to check-out than assist you with their needs. Joe, the concierge, is superb. He's very helpful one of the best I've ever met in a Intercontinental Property. I continue to stay at this hotel as rates are acceptable and as a Holiday Inn Platinum member they provide a executive floor upgrade and various points bonus options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - Service So-So”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Holiday Inn LAX in summer 2010 as a guest of the airline after a flight delay caused me to miss an international connecting flight. Room was fine -- clean, decent amount of space, quiet. Service could be improved. Shuttle took forever to come (several shuttles serving other hotels came and went multiple times before the shuttle for the Holiday Inn finally showed up). Reception staff were harried and tired. I personally had no problem checking in, but the staff were needlessly short with other guests who were attempting to check in. Note that this is a different hotel from the Holiday Inn Express LAX.

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: violet_femme
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night for the sole reason that we were too exhausted to get to the accommodations (a hostel downtown) we had booked before travelling, and because there was a free shuttle from the airport. We arrived around 11pm at night after a full day of working and then travelling (YOW-YYZ-LAX). The desk agent was very helpful and offered us a very reasonably priced room, which we booked for the evening. We were too tired to really check out the accommodations, but it was a fairly clean and well-appointed room, and the quality was good. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The downside was that we woke up to some sort of alarm - possibly a fire alarm? My friend had woken up before me to what she described as a woman screaming loudly in the hallway and then a man's voice yelling "hey!!!" threateningly - it was then, she said, that the alarm started going off. It was still pretty early at this time, and the alarm lasted for long enough that we were unable to get back to sleep. When we went downstairs to see if the concierge could help us map a way to our next destination, we were perturbed to find two uniformed cops in the lobby, perchance connected to the scream and the alarm? The concierge was very helpful and we were able to leave soon after without incident. I would stay again, although not by myself based on that experience. It is very close to the airport and so it's a great place to stay if you're just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Management needs to be recalled!”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the management response at this property is appalling. After waiting 15 minutes on hold to try and obtain missing coffee, missing soap, missing towels, etc, the front desk staff just hung up. Went down to the front desk to find them chatting, laughing, and as another reviewer has noted, all in Spanish...which I do understand. They were ridiculing hotel guests and the fact that they had just hung up on one! It is hard to believe that Holiday Inn corporate allows such behaviors. The property is getting run down already with stained carpets and nasty worn bathroom tubs and furniture. Even third party prices don't make this a worthwhile hotel...unless you speak Spanish..perhaps then the staff will treat you with respect.

Reviews.Title: “HOUSEKEEPING STEALS”
Reviews.Author: skarajan
Reviews.Content: some of our items have been stolen out of the luggage in the room. management pays no attention to this. ATTENTION!!! at the end the room was TOO EXPENSiVE! housekeeping did not replace towels on the floor or empty the trash...i knoe why. they have obviously been too busy seaching in our suitcases

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: akatof
Reviews.Content: Great place to park and fly. Very economical and conveniernt to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location & Nasty”
Reviews.Author: njm0058
Reviews.Content: Kind of grimey, dirty and no decent restaurants around for eating except Denny's. Late night arrival from LAX and then to Denny's with weird people in there! Especially would not be good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Airport after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: zinctop
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed the first night of our holiday it proved to be an excellent choice for us to get a good nights sleep before travelling on to Las Vegas. Hotel/room was clean and staff could not have been more helpful. Would certainly return there on any future trip to California.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: perthchick20
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at this hotel through work with a staff discount rate. Complimentary shuttle bus from airport to hotel every 15 or 20 minutes, all day and night. Bus also stops at 1 or 2 other hotels on the way and very efficient, always on time. Plane arrived at 7 and couldn't check in until 11 as no rooms were available. This is understandable though as the hotel was full and they had to wait for people to check out. The reception staff were very kind and always saying hello. Joe the concierge is brilliant, happy, funny and fantastic at his job. He literally goes at a hundred miles an hour, organising and booking tours for people constantly and efficiently. The room I was given was at the end of a hallway and perfectly sized. King sized bed, clean, very comfortable, good pillows, flat screen tv, room service, hairdryer and basic amenities (hairdryer and toiletries) also a safe. Location is great for those overnight travellers but there isn't much at all around the hotel. A Mcdonalds, couple of gas stations and an internet cafe and restaurant across the road. If you go further down the road though Im sure there are more options but I wasn't fussed and got Mcdonalds for dinner. I would give this room a 5 if it weren't for the tiny blood stain on the top of my blanket cover and the shower shooting the crap out of me. It didn't spray, it shot out like 3 hard water pistols. Checkout was simple and very fast. Overall this hotel is perfect if your just in LA before another flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other holiday inns”
Reviews.Author: One_fly
Reviews.Content: The facility is pretty old. There is a strange smell in the hall way. The tap is leaking in the tub unless you shut It down really hard. Everything has hidden fees. Upgrading from a king bed to two doubles is 20 dollars. Parking is 15 per night. The gate of the parking lot does not work well every time. Internet comes free through.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - charged double”
Reviews.Author: bojo111
Reviews.Content: e stayed at the LAX Holiday Inn on Sunday 8 May. Its facilities are basic, the safe didn't work, there were stains on the carpet, etc. However, of more importance, we submitted a British Airways prepaid voucher for the one night stay, which was accepted on registration, but then, when we checked out, the cashier refused to recognise the prepaid voucher, saying it had no account with BA (highly unlikely) and insisted on charging our credit card. Given this disgraceful behaviour, we will never stay at a Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “a big stopover disappointment, a major struggle”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: [Note to Priceline & other third-party guests] Like everyone else, 3rd-party customers read reviews and have expectations; exceptional attentiveness to guest needs is what distinguishes one 3 star from others. Third-party prices fill otherwise unsold rooms, and provide the hotel with opportunities to sell services and win future business. My advice to Priceline customers: pay attention to reviews, articulate your needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet and you bought from Priceline, tell Priceline in writing; use snail mail to the companyâ€™s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. Iâ€™ve found them responsive. Talk to local management directly, pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational.] OVERVIEW: This hotel is on the busy La Cienega/Century Corner, just off the 405. It advertises itself as â€œrecently renovatedâ€� and the site for â€œfamily fun.â€� I add: not fun without a classic struggle. Overnight travelers, the apparently hardy, and collegiate youth groups and cruise transfers abound: â€œwe have five for two rooms, do you have a room with three beds?â€� Just know: check things out carefully when you arrive. COMMENDABLE: Pleasant (but overworked yet commendably calm) front desk staff. Helpful bell staff. Very nice bedding. Fab towels. Outdoor pool and workout room, I did not experience. Did not use restaurant. Good quality comp internet. Frequent airport shuttle, a vendor that stops at Westin and LaQuinta. At busy times, cannot accommodate all those waiting. Next to a McDonalds, thatâ€™s chaotic all day and night. A bus stop right in front, #171 goes up Century to the more westerly hotels. You can get public transit directions on Google Maps. TROUBLING: Very expensive parking. Poorly explained â€œfree 20 minutesâ€� for checkin and out, requiring entry to secured lot and another front desk wait. MY EXPERIENCE OF ONE NIGHT: no bathmat--easily subbed a towel, no wash cloths. Coffee maker standard but not in room; replaced by a coffee maker but no cups or coffee or condiments, solo coffee maker and wash cloths left outside room door. CHAOS noise at 630 AM while room 203 across the hall was noisily vacuumed--a flood? This was not my choice of arising time. I went to front desk in evening to ask for coffee cup not in room so I could make hot water. This errand occupied 12 minutes, mostly waiting. A lot of waiting is waiting to be â€œhelpedâ€� at the over-busy front desk. Ditto at checkout. I needed to make a call long distance, no charges listed in room guide. Called front desk 2X. Call #1--on hold, cycled to busy. Call #2, asked and was told specifically NO CHARGE FOR 1-800 calls. A charge appeared on my folio which was wiped away after another long wait for attention at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, no issues”
Reviews.Author: bollidear
Reviews.Content: I can't get over excited with the hotel as many have, its hardly the worst in the world and not quite the best. It is what it is - A Holiday Inn EXPRESS close to the airport. Having said close, I never heard a plane asll night, so that wasn't an issue. Don't expect usual Holiday Inn quality (as its on an Express) and you wont' be dissapointed. Pros: Easy to find and plenty of parking, very quick efficient friendly check in. We used reward points. Rooms clean, tidy and realtively modern looking. A very quiet night throughout. Cons: No restaurant for evening meal, no bar (we are British you know!!) and no mini-bar in room. One elevator not working, ice machine on our floor not working and cold drinks machine not working. Not really issues as alternaives available on other floors. BUT.....there is a 7-11 literally around the corner that has snack food, beer, wine etc. All in all - what I would have expected from the discount brand of Holiday Inn....but not a great idea for a LA based holiday - but excellent for a LAX arrival/departure one nighter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overcharged my debit card”
Reviews.Author: FMATP
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review with the intention of warning travelers about how this hotel overcharges their customers (at least this is what happened to me). I stayed on 9/26/2010 only one night (2 rooms). When I checked in I had the intention of staying 2-3 nights but due to work problems I had to left the next day. When I checked in they asked me for my credit card and since apparently it did not have enough limit free, they asked for a second one, which I gave them my debit card. When I checked out, they charged one room to my credit card and the second one to the debit card (this is shown in the hotel bill). Well the charge to my credit card was posted on the 28th of September (one day later than my checkout) in the amount of 2,127.99 pesos (around 151.00 USD) but the charge to my debit card was posted not until Oct/07/2010 in the amount of 10,206.12 pesos (around 729.00 USD), almost five times the correct amount !!! In other words they overcharged me 8,078.13 pesos around 578.00 USD. I contacted Holiday Inn and was given an email address and a reference number to contact guestrelationsemea@ichotelsgroup.com where after some mail exchanges they finally told me that I had to refer to my bank to resolve this issue. I went to my bank, it took some time but they asked me for the original ccard receipts which I unfortunately threw away. DonÂ´t get me wrong, the hotel is O.K. but I find totally unacceptable that they can not return my money. This is completely unprofessional. I frequently do business travel to the US and like to stay at the Holiday Inns, but this type of conduct has changed my opinion to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room but several annoying features”
Reviews.Author: asim11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our trip since it was next to the airport. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. However parking was an extra $15 a day. Which was annoying. Also housekeeping came at 8:30am and knocked loudly on the door waking us up. Then they proceeded on knocking and yelling 'housekeeping' on all the other doors in the hall. The free wifi was okay - pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, shame about view”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebard
Reviews.Content: A stop off after a cruise landed us here before next days flight home. Very big room with what would have been an extensive view if it wasn't that the window was so dirty it might as well have been a frosted bathroom one! Great bed and bathroom of a fine standard. Attending the restaurant gave a satisfying meal spoiled by them adding an 18% gratuity to the bill whether they gave good service or not? Location is bad as there is nothing to walk to unless you can hike 2 miles to the nearest Target store which is not a great position when you're there on the day of the Oscars!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: DinoN11
Reviews.Content: Shuttle shared w/ 2 other hotels, but driver most courteous. Front desk friendly and efficient. Room nice & clean. Lounge food good, fast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: Java73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying out of LAX, and one night was one too many. First we had booked 2 queens a month in advance , but they charged us an extra $20 even though their brochures says that "kids sleep free". Then my husband returned our rental car and tried to catch the shuttle back to the hotel. Because it is a shared shuttle and he was at the end of the airport 3 shuttles passed him by because they were full. He waited almost an hour and would have taken a cab if he'd known. The pool had no towels and our room only had 2 large towels, plus you have to walk through the lobby and outside to reach the pool and fitness area. We ate in the restaurant and even though there were only about 5 people there they sat us with our children beside the only other table there. The "kids eat free" is not advertised and we had to bring it to their attention to get the deal. When the meal finally came they had brought the wrong entree for my son, by by then we'd waited so long we let it go. I went to print out our boarding pass and the internet in the business centre is $0.69/minute plus a charge for printing so I didn't bother. All in all this hotel is not up to what you expect of the brand and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: pachachuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were fine. Restaurant had very loud music and even thought there were only a few tables occupied and two folks at the bar, they would not turn it down. It was too loud to hear conversation. ~ Breakfast across the street (not MacD's) is good and inexpensive ~ Also, you can see the HI sign from the street but be aware that the main entrance is beside the MacDonald's on La Cienega Blvd. ~ Free airport shuttle and proximity to the airport was the reason we stayed

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel and Staff In America.”
Reviews.Author: glasgowrus1
Reviews.Content: Please read this review as it is 100% honest and is intended to warn future travelers about the Holiday Inn LAX. The purpose of my trip was for 6 adult business partners and clients - all traveling seperately and with no personal relationships to spend a week in Los Angeles to attend and work at a major music event. I made the reservation through Priceline and was guaranteed accommodation for 6 adults, with 3 hotel rooms. Upon arrival in 3 cars, we were stopped at the front gate - which is approx. 1/4 of a mile away from the hotel entrance - by a barrier which required us to push a button to validate each car and would charge us $16 per car, per night for parking. Quickly doing some math at the gate I figured that 3 cars for 7 days at $16 per car was going to cost me an extra $336 + 9.5% tax!! This by itself was a huge shock to me as it was a drastic expense for which I had neither planned, budgeted or been told about. They literally wait until you are at the front gate! Obviously, having just got off a red eye flight, we all just wanted to get to bed. At the desk I spoke to the manager on duty, Rodolfo Guitierez, about the parking. His immediate reaction took all of us by surprise...he stated that we should go and park elsewhere if we're not happy. He then started laughing and joking in Spanish to his staff which made me afraid for my safety as I was in a city I had never visited before. He would even start to address me in Spanish and then convert back to English mid-sentence. Is this the type of point-of-contact customer service that Holiday Inn is training their employees, especially managers? It was very clear that this man was tired, angry and had a very short temper. Any kind of bargaining or simple question was shot down in flames with a very stern "will that be all senor?". I am Sir not Senor. At this point, whilst realizing that I'm going to have to fork out for the parking, I just wanted some sleep. This next part just blows my mind. All 6 of us went to our respective 3 reserved rooms and looked on in horror as we discovered that each room only had 1 bed. This is the first time in my entire traveling life that I have booked a room for 2 people where they only give you 1 bed. I immediately thought that there was a mistake, so I went to the front desk again, to speak to the same manager, again. I told him that there are 6 of us so we need 6 beds. He very aggressively told me that each room now only has 1 bed and for a second bed there is a surcharge of $22 per night. Again, calculating 3 extra beds at $22 per night per bed for 7 days, I was looking at an additional $462 + 9.5% tax. This made the situation very distressing, as I had chosen this run down hotel at a cheaper rate with priceline and now realized that for the same price I could have stayed in a 5 star hotel in Hollywood. I tried to reason with the manager and explain my situation but he was clearly in no mood to talk to guests. He has obviously dealt with this same subject with many, many previous guests as he was almost expecting my questions and was basically ignoring them. He told me to call Priceline and move aside to allow other guests to check in. I called Priceline and had quite possibly the longest, most pointless conversation with a middle eastern girl who would not answer any questions. I asked for a supervisor and was told that there are no supervisors. I hung up. I then called Holiday Inn corporate office and spoke to a man who was very nice and told me he would contact the hotel manager to resolve the problem. I then received a call to my room from the same manager as before, Rodolfo, who yelled at me that if I wanted extra beds, I should just pay for them or just share a bed. Unfortunately, the hotel and Priceline won the battle by just shutting off communication and refusing to remedy the problems. After much screaming, tearing hair out and long phone calls, we were forced to remain at the hotel and share beds, as well as paying hundreds of dollars just to park our cars. I am truly disgusted. My whole company are disgusted and please be assured that none of us will ever stay at a Holiday Inn or use Priceline again. Ever. An awful experience which ruined the entire trip. Is this what travel has come down to? Desperate hotels and booking companies letting morals fly out the window and adding charge after charge for meaningless nonsense such as a parking spot or an additional bed? One thing is clear - you are no longer a guest at a hotel, you are a cash cow, in every sense of the word. All in all I was quite pleased with the cleanliness and location, but from the bottom of my heart and speaking from alot of traveling experience, this was the worst and rudest staff and management my business partners and I have ever, ever encountered. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jeppa3579
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn for one night. My family checked in together for a long layover before leaving that night. The hotel is clean and very convenient because of its proximity to the airport (though not in the walking distance). The free shuttle service is shared by Westin and La Quinta, so the wait between shuttles is 20 minutes or a bit longer. I saw a long line for checking in in the evening. The free wifi internet was fast. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, considering that I had to go through urine smell in my earlier stay at the neighboring Westin (to be fair, that was back in 2001).

Reviews.Title: “Really good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Brandon_MacD
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with a couple of clients who were going to a couple of cities in California on business. We try to travel to hotels close to airports. This hotel suited our needs well. We were satisfied with the overall hotel and the service. The hotel looks newly renovated and contemporary looking. The front desk service was very good. Only suggestion would be a complimentary continental breakfast but still we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Aged property that is high on function and low on aesthetics”
Reviews.Author: sojourneys
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Holiday Inn Los Angeles International Airport, and it was everything I imagined an airport hotel situated near LAX would be â€” a relatively aged property, high on functionality, low on aesthetics. The hotel is designed to facilitate a short stay for those who need little more than a convenient place to turnaround before the next flight. This is especially crucial for LAX, because an ordinarily hour drive to the frenetic airport could easily turn into a two-hour nightmare on the road with the infamous choke-a-bloc Los Angeles freeways. There is a constellation of all the major hotels around LAX, and airline crew retiring from their flights for the day before reporting for the following dayâ€™s routes are a constant feature in the lobby of the Holiday Inn. There is a small pool and a meager fitness room comprising a couple of treadmills and eplliptical machines.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable, Amazing, Incredible and Outstanding Concierge Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: RSCalifornia88
Reviews.Content: Joe SATTER ONLY!!! Once my travels were confirmed, I contacted the hotel and spoke with Joe. Awe struck by Joeâ€™s willingness to assist me will indeed go down in my records as one of the most accommodating personnel that Iâ€™ve encountered in the hotel industry. When we spoke via phone, he stated, â€œwhen you arrive, just ask for Joe and I will take care of you.â€� Upon my arrival, I spoke with him directly as he immediately begin to assist me with my request. And to my surprise and amazement his words rang true as he literally took care of me. He introduced me to VIP Tours, as I definitely saw value in the opportunity. He was not rude or pushy; he simply stated, â€œI think going on the tour would be a great experience for you.â€� Since I didnâ€™t have long in LA, he assisted in helping me maximize my small window of time. The next day, it was raining and I was leery about going anywhere however, Joe recommended Manhattan Village and stated this would be a great indoor adventure and to take advantage of the opportunity, and so I did.. He walked me to the door explaining where to catch the trolley. He provided me a brochure that listed the pickup times as well as the correct stop. Also I must mentioned, he appeared very insightful in regards to a personâ€™s need. As an organization your company should be proud to have JOE on your team. I am a firm believer that my stay would not have been pleasant had I not met Joe.. He JUMPED a little higher, Ran a little faster and for SURE WOWâ€™ed ME!!!!! Joe you are the BEST. J-Jovial- infectious personality O-Optimist- contagious energy E-Extraordinary MAN who made my visit simply the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cthoops
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel after bidding on Priceline, and was more than satisfied. I stayed the night before an early a.m. departure from LAX, and would not hesitate to stay there again. It looks newly remodeled, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. There was also a free shuttle to LAX. Bottom line, I hope to stay there again the next time I have an early flight out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt01x
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel while having a stop-over in Los Angeles and were suprised by the good hotel standard which we didn't expect from a regular airport hotel. Although the hotel is quite out-of-town you can easily reach the city and most of the sights by hiring a car, which the front-desk is happy to assist you with. Breakfast was ok and check-in/out procedures were quite efficient. It's a good hotel but if you want to experience the city you rather want to go for a hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Dirt marks and hair in bath tub, otherwise a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: 1ManhattanBeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 days. The hotel is virtually on W Century Blvd, right next to La Quinta Inn. The check in/out were very smooth. The staff at front desk and concierge were pleasant and professional. I was shocked to see dirt marks and hairs in the bathtub - there was also a hair in the basin. I was too tired to complain and organise the cleaning. I had had an 11 hour flight from UK and it was about 2am British time and all I wanted was a good quick soak in a bath and a warm drink before going to bed. I quickly cleaned the bath tub and basin with my body wash and a face towel. The bathroom remained unclean for the rest of my stay. Everyday when I came back, there were hairs on the floor, especially around the edges. The floor beneath the basin looked filthy with a couple of twisted tissue bits which seemed to have been wet then left dried, and also with other dirts. On the outside of the urinal there were areas which looked filthy with yellowish marks. The bedroom looked clean. The housekeeping remained generally poor. There was always something missing - sometimes there were no face towels. sometimes I had run out of shampoo and conditioner but these amenities had not been replaced. The hotel supplied coffee maker and free coffee but all they suppled with the machine were packets of coffee - there were no sugar/cream/stir bars. Sometimes there weren't even cups. These were never supplied unless I asked. it was not normal that I had to ring House Keeping dept so often for missing amenities. This was my 4th visit to LA and I have stayed at other 3 star hotels such as Holiday Inn Torrance and Hilton Garden Inn Lax/El Segundo (both were magical) - but the housekeeping at this hotel was the worst. Someone needs to supervise it. The furniture was slightly less than Holiday Inn Torrance but was decent enough. A small table and a mini fridge would have been nice. The hotel shuttle service was good and punctual, about every 15 mins, and all the drivers were helpful and efficient. I was a bit bothered with the airplane noise in the beginning but i god used to it after a few days. There was a constant rumbling sound in the distance and the airplane noise can get high occasionally. Despite that I slept so well - there were no flights roughly between 11pm and 6am, and the bed was so comfy! During my stay LA had record high temperatures but the room remained nice and cool, the air con was very quiet. The internet connection was not "high speed" as they advertise. It can get pretty slow at times. It took 25 mins to check in online. I did not bother using their business center (chargeable) to print the boarding pass as they can do that for you at Baggage Drop at the airport. They charge for parking but there were some free parking spaces (can fill up quickly) at the back of the hotel and the area looked ok, I saw locals jogging and taking a dog. In front of the hotel and McDonald (right beside the hotel with AmPm convenience store) I saw a couple of homeless people occasionally, but they seemed harmless. The reason why I chose to stay in a LAX hotel was that I was not going to have a car and the area had a good transport system. I often took hop on/off Ocean Express Trolly ($5 round trip) from the nearby stop to Manhattan Beach (gorgeous), Manhattan Village Mall and El Segundo Plaza (the organic shop Whole Foods was lovely). I took frequent Rapid 3 bus to Santa Monica ($1 one way), and to Downtown LA I took express 439 bus which takes a nicer route via Westchester and Culver City. There are also super shuttles to Disneyland and you could take train to Hollywood. I also went to Tom Bradley terminal at LAX to go to Pink's Hot Dogs and I did not have to queue. I did not use the hotel restaurant/lounge. There were fast food eateries nearby and you could cross the road and go to Starbucks or the Daily Grill in Westin Hotel. I bought my morning bread and fruit at whole Foods. Overall, If the housekeeping improves then I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, it served its purpose very well otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: Competent quick check-in. Large but plainly decorated, bland rooms, with chipped work desk. Good bedding and standard amenities, but excellent shower. Rooms are well sound proofed. Coffee shop on ground floor in evening has excellent service and very good food, also very good selection of wines by the glass. However, breakfast buffet is overpriced ($16), so-so, with mediocre service and awful coffee. Overall, good for one night's rest if you need to stay near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, convenient”
Reviews.Author: purplevenus24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn LA International Airport for one night. I wasn't expecting much, but was surprised to find I had a very spacious, clean and comfortable room. The staff organised an all-day driver for me so I could go shopping (in a Bentley, which was pretty and spacious, but more extravagant than I needed). As with all hotels near the airport, the free shuttle between the airport and hotel was timely, frequent and convenient. Also, I found this place to be awesome value for money.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL SERVICE EVER! DO NOT STAY HERE! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!”
Reviews.Author: wendy5o4
Reviews.Content: Normally, I do not waste my time to write a review on TripAdvisor.com unless I receive above and beyong great service or...the opposite. In this case, it was the opposite. I made reservations to stay here for only one night because my flight wasn't due to depart until the following morning, so based on the reviews and the fact that this hotel was "supposedly" newly renovated, I took the chance and booked with them. I've stayed at numerous hotels before and never have I encountered the type of service I received from this establishment. First of all, my flight was 2 hours late so by the time I arrived at the Holiday Inn, it was almost 1 am. When I arrived, the front desk was extremely busy checking in guests left and right, but there was no need for them to be so curt. (My callers also mentioned the front desk staff was not very friendly when they called asking for me.) As for the guestroom itself, it's nothing special and the pictures that are depicted online are not accurate. The rooms have been furnished with modern furniture, but was done rather quickly - which can be seen though the lack of "quality" and detail. Here's the issue that really bothered me: The following morning, the front desk woke me up at 8 am asking me if I was going to check out now?! I told them I had asked for an 8:30 am wake-up call and it didn't make any sense for them to start calling guests at 8 am when some people are still asleep AND the fact that check-out time isn't until 12 pm. THIS WAS THEIR RESPONSE: Most of the guests check out by this time (i.e. flight attendants, pilots, etc.) so if you do not want to be disturbed, you need to put your do not disturb sign outside your door. I was like "WHAT!?" Who in their right mind manages a hotel in this manner? I have never - repeat - NEVER encountered a hotel's check-out policy to this degree. So after being woken up already, I try to go back to sleep and can't so I just pack my stuff and go downstairs to check-out. When I go downstairs, I tell the desk clerk what happened and she explained the same thing to me like this was the norm. This is how I would sum up my stay here (and remember, I only stayed here a few hours and encountered these issues): 1. If you want to get a good night's sleep, do not stay here. 2. If you want to receive great guest service, do not stay here. 3. If you want to hear imcompetant excuses from an imcompetant staff, do not stay here. 4. If you want a higher quality guestroom with accurate picture depicting the room quality, do not stay here. Holiday Inn is not the brand it's being advertised to be and this hotel is a great example as to why. Next time, I will pay $30 or even $50 more so I can get at least a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrianChiu
Reviews.Content: Looks like it just renovated,room was clean and very comfy, no fridge in my room though; free WiFi and airport shuttle was excellent!
