Parking cost 15.00 plus tax which is bit pricey,but it's underground garage which is safer; there's a SMALL pool and a SMALL gym. And McDonald's and convenient store are right beside it.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat for the price -- great value.”
Reviews.Author: NoiceTampa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday Inn for four nights in late July 2010. First off: do not confuse this Holiday Inn for the Holiday Inn Express nearby which ALSO has LAX or Los Angeles Airport in its title. This Holiday Inn is on La Cienega Blvd, (corner of Century Blvd.) Reviewers are correct, recently renovated this year, and it shows. Not all aspects were renovated, but the most important things in our room felt new. New King bed, fresh sheets, new furniture, new TV, new bathroom mostly. Everyone we interacted with was very friendly, as if they had just received a lecture on importance of being attentice (and they truly were). No mishaps at all, hotel is not that loud, we slept soundly every night. Only thing I would mention -- and it's not really that big a deal -- is the water temp. in the shower. Never seen anything like it, when the water flows from the bottom, hotter than hell, and steady heat. When you slide the switch to shower from up top, the heat fluctuates from lukewarm to damn hot every five seconds or so. Unexplainable, but am mentioining it because another reivewer reported the same. All in all, GREAT CHEAP option, and worth the $100 or so per night. Book through Expedia or Travelocity and check both just to make sure one is not ripping you off.

Reviews.Title: “service = fail.”
Reviews.Author: hosr9
Reviews.Content: we booked this through a travel displacement coupon that we received. i made the booking, and the agent told me to call the property directly and confirm. the agent with the holiday inn had no idea what we were talking about. i hung up and tried someone who would know what was going on, and he told us that it is confirmed and just to show up. the shuttle is a gong show, but that is more of an LAX thing than the hotel. we get to the property, and the same useless agent that answered the phone checked us in. i reminded him that i am a priority club gold (i know, not much, but, c'mon). he says that all i get is 10% off at the restaurant. wooooowwww. he also didn't seem to take into account that we were guys, so he put us in a room with a king bed. when we called, the phone rung out after two minutes. so we went downstairs to complain. he said the hotel was sold out. interesting, considering i got it last minute for $65. he said there would be a charge for the cot. i told him that i am not paying for the cot and that he should bring us two cots. he said that was not possible, so i asked for someone useful. out came the supervisor and he said he would take care of it. so we go to in'n'out in the mean time, come back, and no cots. it was then about 0200hrs. so i call housekeeping. voicemail. call the front desk, rung out after three minutes. go downstairs to lobby. see a group of ten being "helped" by the useless front desk clerk. go back upstairs. ring it out five minutes. someone else answers, says two cots will come up. matron comes up 20 mins later at 0250 with one cot. we ask for another. he refuses. go through front desk again. told by useless agent that it is against the fire code for more than two cots to be in a room. demand supervisor. supervisor says same thing. we ask to see the fire code. none produced. it is now 0330 and our flight departs at 0725. we give up. the rooms were ok, but upon moving one of the chairs to the corner, we saw a few stale cashews and chips covered in dust. considering all the choice of hotels in LAX, particularly those that are closer to the terminal, i say: go somewhere else. if you're like me and you hate showing up to the airport 5 hours before a flight, take a taxi directly to your terminal. worth every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but remote - a good place to sleep off jet lag”
Reviews.Author: Lassie1970
Reviews.Content: The start of a long trip in the USA and the end of a very long flight from Australia! The hotel was quick to get to with a free shuttle to/from the airport. Check in was quick and while the corridor had a funny smell, the room was clean and fresh and the bed was so comfortable! The room was large, the bathroom clean and modern and the double glazing keeps out any noise. It is not in the best part of town but a good place to crash after a long flight before getting up and starting your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Surprise at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Jeffontheroad
Reviews.Content: I had an extremely late check in (4am... too much partying...) but the staff was able to take good care of me. I was given a room on the "executive level" or "Priority Club Level" as a Platinum and was amazed at the comfort and quality of the bed. You can tell that this hotel was recently renovated and everything looked new and fresh. Very quiet hotel considering its location near LAX and very convenient to Century Blvd and LAX. Bathrooms were spacious and very clean. Pool area was nice, but small. I thought the hotel was an excellent value considering what other hotels at LAX charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bear55
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Very clean, comfortable beds, flat screen TV. Shuttle service to airport on time and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: SanFransiscoPaul
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised to read such great reviews, but then it was these great reviews that made me book this hotel in the first place. May be I should have read them all! Where do I begin. It was very noisy and you could hear the people walking upstairs and people talking outside. I did not sleep well and did not feel very safe. Look elsewhere.The hotel is NOT SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: Apparently they just spent $16M to renovate this hotel. And is showed! Looks nice inside. I was lucky to get this for $45 a night (there for three nights) Nice lobby, spacious rooms with new furniture and beds. Bathrooms were also renovated with granite counters. Good outdoor pool and a decent workout room - nothing special, but they keep it up. Bar area is pretty decent and food was pretty good. Nothing special. There is also a MCDonalds a 100 feet from the hotel so that is nice. Close to the airport with shuttle service. Solid place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: travlerNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I always thought Holiday Inn hotels were nothing special until I stayed in this one. I was blown away by every detail of this hotel. It was brilliant in every regard of the word. The room we were in was quiet, very clean and extremely comfortable. It was a delight to have this room between long flights. The kids enjoyed the outdoor pool and the services were second to none. The breakfast we had was fantastic and the waiter was truly brilliant. Nothing was too much for him. There was nothing I could fault about the accommodation - everyone was a big help and organised our transport to attractions quickly and provided good advice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-multiple Holiday Inn Express locations near LAX”
Reviews.Author: jillsbury
Reviews.Content: Hotel experience was great for our needs (flying in and out of LAX) Beware: there are two Holiday Inn Express Hotels near the airport. Neither the hotel shuttle drivers nor desk personnel seem to know to suggest that you may be at the wrong hotel. Make certain that you know the correct address to spare yourself the frustration we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight place”
Reviews.Author: PinayRox
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the HI-LAX and was pleasantly surprised. It was newly renovated. The room was large and had ample room for luggage. Bathroom was a nice size. It 's a great bargain for anyone who needs an overnight place at the Los Angeles Airport. There was also a free shuttle that took you to and from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at the Holiday Inn LAX. As an airport hotel, it's a decent, well priced choice. The rooms are average sized but newish furniture. The new flat screen TV had decent picture quality. The bed was comfortable enough for night of sleep. And there was good shower pressure and decent amenities in the washroom. The rooms were also well maintained. The hotel restaurant seemed nice enough, although not the most innovagtive of menu choices. There is a laundry room with seats while you wait. My only complaint is the rooms are not the most sound proof. Though I didn't hear any airplane noise, it's possible to hear sound from the hallway and the adjacent room. The airport shuttle services 3 hotels (the Westin, La Quinta and Holiday Inn) so budget around 35 minutes to get out of LAX depending on which terminal you are being picked up. On the return to LAX, make sure you give yourself more time to get there in the morning. I had to wait after 2 shuttles were full.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel, Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: I gave 4* to this property in comparison to other hotels at this price level and to the holiday inn chain. Seriously, being in the IHG hotel group, this holiday inn beats some of their higher level Crown Plaza rooms. Lobby has been renovated so did the rooms. Everything is now bright and looks fresh. The new holiday inn bed was surprisingly comfortable. I had comfortable sleep when I was really sick that day. The duvet has been changed to the new HI standard, no more thick polyester blanket that was heavy enough to kill me! YAY for the big improvement. The only pet peeve for the room is their AC system. Kinda loud but thankfully its individual AC control (Unlike some hotels you can't really do much about ur room temperature). Parking is expensive, but its hard to find cheap parking nearby in this neighborhood. Its good for overnight guests and bargain minded budget travelers since this hotel's price is affordable and there are plenty 24 hour dining options within walking distance (McDonalds, Taco Bell/Pizza Hut express, AM PM is right in front of the hotel). Subway is across the street. I wouldn't recommend travelers visiting LA to stay around LAX area. Don't stay in downtown LA and LAX area when you visit LA. There are much more better options to stay / see LA.

Reviews.Title: “For an in transit hotel: Reliable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: IaOrana_Maruuruu
Reviews.Content: I needed an overnight in Los Angeles and was looking for convenience, affordability and good room. I got all three. Shuttle to the airport was convenient and quick. Restaurant was adequate (not a stellar breakfast), internet services were good quality. Hotel room was pleasant and clean. Noise from the hallways at 3 a.m. was unfortunate, but all in all, a good, reliable place to stay in transit if you're not looking for "an experience". My star rating is based on my expectations for an in-transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEPLESS IN LA”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights waiting for the ash cloud to clear. The good points have already been stated. Nice room. clean. pleasant and efficient staff etc etc. The bad points are I had a room on the top floor overlooking McDonalds. the noise from the airport was continuous 24/7. The air con wasn't quite so loud but didn't help. When I checked out the receptionist asked if everything was OK and seemed surprised when I mentioned the noise. Quote "We don't hear the planes down here" If you are going to stay here get a room on a low floor at the back. They have a free WiFi which is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, and convenient for one night before flight to Asia”
Reviews.Author: Al-Burj
Reviews.Content: I was flying from New York to Asia, connecting through LAX, and needed to find a hotel to stay for just one night that was near the airport. I was able to use frequent flier miles to book this, it wasn't the cheapest option, in terms of miles, but was the best value. The other reviews are accurate and there are already plenty of photos so I will only upload a few. Note that the airport shuttle is NOT a dedicated Holiday Inn van/bus but is shared with several other hotels. Because of this you do need to allot enough time to get to/from the airport as the bus will make other stops. On my way back to the airport the bus was 80% flight crews from various airlines! I had a little bit of a problem connecting to the internet, but it was free (one reason I picked this hotel). Overall I was satisfied with what this was, a nice clean hotel convenient to the airport. Probably not the best hotel for tourist visiting LA as a destination. The bed was INCREDIBLY comfortable and on par with beds in much more expensive hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly convenient if you stay as a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Highadventurer
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay with reasonable rates booked via internet. It was convenient with the shuttle bus picking you out from nearly exit gates and drop you at the hotel which is less than 5 minutes away with a few stops along the way. If you are for a couple of days you can avoid renting a car and save a few bucks esp if your primary objective is take a tour from nearby tour company to DisneyLand, Universal Studio or downtown city tour. No compliant about their food at the inhouse restaurand and of course if you are scrimping for shopping or the touristy amusement park go get yourself a big mac at the McDonald just outside the hotel. I walked out further and found one or two other cafes but did not feel it was too safe for me to wander about the street having heard so much around the crime around the area. Anyhow it is foolhardy for anyone walking out past 9pm in search of pizza if Big Mac or the hotel restaurant won't do. The hotel is indeed retrofitted as you can see from the carpet and decor and fittings at the lobby which is businesslike though small but adequate. Overall, don't expect scenery outside your window as this is LAX and not Beverly Hills. I would recommend this hotel as opposed to the other motels nearby (which i prefer not to name) and if you could afford the time and the costs there are plenty of posh hotels downtown. One other warning to overseas tourists using this hotel - if you go on a disneyland whole day/late night trip don't stay till the fireworks finishes and miss your tour bus cos they will not wait more than 15 mins beyond schedule. If you missed, good luck to you as it would costs you more than a 100 bucks to take a taxi back to this hotel at LAX. Overall 3 star and value for money if you are on 2-3 day tour thus saving on car rental, time and fuel costs burnt up commuting.

Reviews.Title: “Another Solid Stay at the HI LAX”
Reviews.Author: thebeerhunter
Reviews.Content: We had to overnight at LAX at the last minute prior to heading to French Polynesia, due to a cyclone delaying our flight out. I booked a night at the Holiday Inn LAX from the Admirals Club in the airport, and then went down to catch the shuttle over to the hotel. Check in was fast and efficient. I was put on the top floor (which they say is for Priority Club members) and was given a room facing the airport (my request, so we could watch the planes land). In room internet is fast and free. Food from the restaurant downstairs was hot and decent; not the best, not bad either. Having tried several airport hotels around LAX I've found this one to be the best of everything: not too expensive, very good shuttle schedule to/from the airport, quiet rooms, good strong AC that masks the airplane noise very well. Staff is friendly. This was our second stay since they completed their refurbishment, and I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel In Crime Ridden Area”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: Rooms were okay, free wifi, the restaurant was a little overpriced. The main thing for travelers to Los Angeles, dont stay near the airport if you can help it. Century Blvd and La Cienega is known for the homeless, prostitution, and overall crime. Try to stay at least 5 miles from there in the cities of Manhattan Beach, Redodno Beach, and Torrance near the Del Amo Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved - Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Forwarder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three or four years ago, and thought it was a dump. I avoided staying here the last three trips but after the terrible service I had last time at the Westin and reading the recent reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to give the Holiday Inn across the street another chance; I made the right choice. The hotel was remodeled about two years ago and it is so much better! The restaurant is now well lit and spacious with a good menu and very reasonably priced, the bar has daily Happy Hour; the rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. They use the same Shuttle service as the Westin and it runs to/from the airport every 20 minutes 24/7. I will stay here again my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, plush and sophisitcated”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks and feels like a top hotel. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, but it is without the price tag of top hotels. With cheap secure parking and wifi as well, why would you stay in another more expensive hotel. One word of warning though, be careful around the hotel. It is not a very nice area, and there are some interesting characters around as we found out whilst in the McDonalds next door. But you are as close as you need to be for the international airport, so the location is neither here nor there, I imagine all of the LAX area is the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: tigerkueken
Reviews.Content: Been there in December/January 2009/2010 for a total of 4 nights and we were really surprised about how nice the hotel was. Free Wireless LAN (though sometimes slow during evening hours), extremely tidy and all-modern. The economy room didn't look like economy at all, it was really big with a big flat screen TV. The bathroom was neat and tidy, everything was really pleasant. The location was also really good, next to LAX but still no airplane noise (suppose they had special windows). We would definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SavinienCyrano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn LAX for four nights during our California vacation. The hotel seems to be newly renovated and is looking very good from the out- and inside. The rooms are very spacious and designed in a very modern way. Nearly no aviation noise due to thick windows, but the neighborhood is admittedly not the most beautiful one. Can recommend for everyone who is looking for a cheap and highly convenient stay close to the airport. Rental car recommended for trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lauriebrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a morning flight to avoid worrying about rush hour traffic. What a dump! I don't know where the pictures were taken of those lovely, spacious rooms with the gorgeous bathrooms, but that looked nothing like where we stayed. We were greeted with a check-in line, a security guard telling my husband he couldn't park in front to wait for me to check in, rude staff, and a $14 parking fee (must have gone up since the reviews written a few weeks ago?). The garage parking was not convenient to a hotel entrance when you have luggage to carry. There was no working ice machine on my floor or the next one up and I finally went to the hotel bar instead of climbing more stairs in search of one that worked. The tub was dripping a steady stream when we arrived but calling the front desk, room service, operator, or the concierge got me only a recording and it was only 9pm. So we had to sleep listening to that until the traffic droned it out starting at 6 am. Breakfast, I was told, was a $14 buffet. We opted for the less expensive and more convenient McDonald's about 30 yards from the front of the hotel. In order to check-out we had to wait in line again. This is because they had to validate our parking ticket in order for us to be able to get out of the parking garage. In hindsight I would rather have stayed at a nice hotel with friendly staff and working plumbing and struggled through an hour of highway traffic in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: unckebuck
Reviews.Content: Was in LA for the night to catch a flight home the next day. The hotel is recently retrofitted and I was pleased with the service and staff were accommodating. The room was clean and well appointed. I booked via the internet on the Holiday Inn website as I find the prices are more competitive than calling the front desk. The only catch by booking on the internet is that there are no refunds or changes. The breakfast buffet was good as well. Staff accommodating and the dishes well presented. I would recomend this property and would make it a point of staying here again if in the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: unplainjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Holiday Inn LAX because of an early flight I had the next day. The hotel is not terrible but with so much choice around the area I would not stay here again. The hotel looks shabby inside and outside. Pretty much only one elevator worked so you'd have to wait ages and then when you got an elevator you'd be crammed in because of all the people waiting. My room was actually okay. Nicer then I expected compared to the public hotel areas. Though when I got in both lamps beside my bed did not work. One lamp did not have a lightbulb in it and the other had a bulb that didn't work. So i had to unscrew a bulb from my desk lamp to put into my bed lamp. Ridiculous. As well there is apparently free wifi in the hotel but my signal was almost non existent. I called the front desk to tell them and they said it was because I was in a room at the end of hall, and I couldn't use ethernet because only the top floors had ethernet connections. So I had to go down to the desk to pick up some ridiculous internet kit that didn't make my signal better anyways. I was also annoyed that they put a $175 charge on my bill for the kit. I later found out the charge would be taken off when I returned the kit but no one told me of this charge in the first place. A hassle. As well my toilet didn't fully flush properly. I'd have to flush a couple of times for it to work. And I had a lovely view of the back of McDonalds from my room. The pool was pretty depressing. It overlooked another dingy looking hotel across the way. The service at the bar was nice though. Even though the bar area doesn't have a lot of character. And it was convenient they had frequent shuttles to the airport but I'm sure all hotels in the area have that. For dinner we went to Flemings steak house which is a short drive away. Excellent food and service. Would recommend making a reservation. So with all the choices there are in the LAX area I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: MOM_Milpitas
Reviews.Content: This is an awful hotel for family. It also charges extra $12 for parking, which I didn't expect. when I made reservation. In hotel room, you could hear the noise from airplane. The front desk staff is not that friendly either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, competent hotel that's comfortable”
Reviews.Author: livinginpenang
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night after a long flight into LAX (2 adults, kids aged 3 and 6). Mainly looking for a hotel near the airport with transportation, comfort, and quiet so we could get some rest. Fits the bill perfectly. The beds were only doubles but were very comfortable. The room was very clean and in excellent shape. My only complaint was that the air conditioning was also too strong when it came on. It has a restaurant but we took the kids next door for McD's. We walked 5 minutes to a pretty good Mexican restaurant but generally the area is on a main road and not really for wandering. Stick with the hotel. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LondonBanana
Reviews.Content: I had a 12 hour lay over in LA, so I decided to book a room at a hotel close by until my next flight. The service started from the moment I called them to ask whether I could check in at 5am as my flight got in at about 430am. That was fine and I was allowed to check out at 3pm instead of 12pm. The Hotel shuttle was super easy to find/use and the drivers were very friendly. Checking in was a breeze. The rooms are very tidy and a wonderful sight for the weary traveller. The bed was great. The staff in the Hotel downstairs were very professional and friendly. It was great reading my book and napping beside the pool. Downsides? The water in the shower was tepid (I like my showers hot). While I was trying to sleep I heard school children running up and down the hall and then cleaners conversing loudly. To be fair, it was the middle of the day and most people would be out and about not sleeping in their hotel rooms. Overall it was a great experience and I would stay again if I needed to stay comfortably close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good even for visiting LA, cheaper and quality alternative”
Reviews.Author: benybell
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel before our departure from LAX, for 1 night. But had we known the quality and price, we would have definitely stayed for 2 or 3 nights when visiting LA, instead of wandering through overpriced and lousy motels in other districts. The location is good for both, the airport and the city, especially Santa Monica and Venice Beach, two of the coolest places in LA. We stayed at a king-bed room on 12th floor. the room seemed to have been renovated recently, furnishing was even stylish a bit. Flat screen 32" TV, clean and spacious bathroom, coffee-maker made our stay really pleasant. The check-out was at 12 noon, which was convenient. Be careful though about the rate. Basic rate is competitive, but then hotel charges you small amounts for nearly anything you use + like the PC&internet in the lobby (0,7$ per minute), parking lot (13$), breakfast (you get a coupon for 10$ for each person, which needs additional payment event for a continental buffet). They are also tipping themselves on your bill for breakfast service, even if you're having a buffet! This was pretty ridiculous. Be also aware of the noise, if you mind hearing aircrafts approaching the runway. The hotel is really close to airport and windows do not absorb all the noise. Anyway, I liked seeing jumbos approaching just behind my window and we did not mind the noise. Anyway, bearing in mind that the hotels in LA are so overpriced and offer such a low quality of service, I would definitely come back to this airport hotel even for a longer LA visit. Motorways connecting with other parts of the city are just couple of blocks away. Staff was OK, friendly and informative, lobby clean and comfortable, parking spacious, there are two gas stations nearby if you are refuelling your rental car before return.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: cjeffg24
Reviews.Content: Although we weren't there long, just overnight since we had an extremely early flight the next morning. Great beds, the best we slept in during our entire stay. Very nice and updated rooms. Close to a McDonald's, in case you get an urge. I got this room through Priceline for $55, so I was extremely pleased with everything. Since we left so early we were not able to take advantage of the breakfast. Quick free shuttle ride to the airport too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for LAX”
Reviews.Author: LK2807
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here from the 13th to the 15th of September for ease of access to the airport. We had come off a cruise on the sunday morning at around 7am so we got to the hotel about 9 30am and asked if it was possible to check in early (about 6hours early) and the lady on the front guest was more than helpful and said it was no problem! We were in room 1207, right next to the elevator, if you get this room asked if its possible to move if your a light sleeper as its right next to the elevator like i said so its constant noise, we werent bothered as we were hardly in the room as we were out with friends for the whole two days and out a lot of the nights too :) We got a double queen room, beds were really comfy, room was very clean and the bathroom was very clean too. When we had a shower the bath tub filled up aswell there was something wrong with the plug not sure what, but we arent fussy people so it didnt bother us, we did ask for extra towels at one point and had to ring the front desk twice as they forgot the first time but thats not a major problem really is it? If your looking to sightsee id find somewhere closer to the city but its a great stop over for easy access to LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you can get the discounted rates”
Reviews.Author: garbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as we had an early 7.45 flight the next morning. I traveled with my husband, 3 year old son and a 7 month old baby. The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms are quite nice. Bathrooms have granite countertops, nice waterpik shower head with good water pressure, flat screen tv in bedroom. Mattress was comfortable. For our baby we were given a nice white metal baby cot, with linen already done up for her, with towels and bath products. The bath products (shampoo and conditioner) were for an adult, but i thought it was a nice touch. plus the cot had a baby bumper, which i have never seen at a hotel before. I thought they must have cheaped out during the renovation, as the outside of the bedroom door must have been repainted instead of being replaced. looked old. Also the bath tub must have been re-painted or the finish was coming off. Staff were not that friendly or helpful. They are pretty strict about not parking infront of reception even to unload your car. We had a rental car that we were planning to return and didn't want to park in the lot.They give you 20-30 minutes free to park your car, and unload there. When we checked out, they charged us a day's parking rate ($12), but happily removed it off our bill. There is a mcdonalds, la qunita hotel right next store. We rented a car at thrifty just a few blocks away, which was very convenient, as you could walk back to the hotel after returning the vehicle in 10 minutes. There is a shuttle bus, which they normally charge $1 per person, but when we checked in we got vouchers, so it was free. The bus comes every 15 minutes. I would recommend this hotel, since we got a rate at $85 for an advanced purchase. This is a great deal for the LAX airport area. If the room was over $130 i would stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Could of been better”
Reviews.Author: ohscuban
Reviews.Content: Well what can you say for a 3 star hotel, in my experience a lot more than for this one. The price was well of course good but i don't know if i liked the service too much. I stayed for about a week and every day the floor was never vacuumed. I did like the TV that they had but didn't like that when you turn the tv on it was real loud every time you turn it on, sorry I'm not deaf i only need the volume on 10 not 30. on the first night 1/2 the towels weren't there and no washcloths i guess they want me to hand wash myself or sum thing. I made sure they gave me extra towels next time they cleaned, but they didn't even give me extra shampoo, i really don't like washing my hair with a bar of soap. The front desk lady was very nice and sweet, but the concierge seemed ignorant and lazy. When I tried to ask for information he just keep telling me something different, he completely avoided my question, maybe he didn't know. I'm always going on on business and I like to be able to have wifi where I stay at. the wifi was free at this location, but for some reason the service would always drop and I would have to wait like five minutes for it to come back up. At times when it would work it ran real slow and would have to wait just to pull up google. I finally got it to work though when i decided to see if there were any other place to get internet, the La Quinta had fast internet When I called the concierge once again I felt like i was talking to a wall. Also didn't enjoy having to grab all of my own things and push them around on the cart, where was the bus boy? I would guess I can't complain too much though price was good, but I though a three star would of been a little better than that? wouldn't it have?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new rooms with very helpful desk staff-they treat everyone well, even discount buyers. Very responsive to any requests for help. Parking reasonable by LA standards. Morning bell captain and Laura on Pm shift for check in very proferssional. Excellent choice for LAX. Be careful of nearby restaurant parking lot-very busy. Bar area in hotel and restaurant staff very good as well-worth staying in to eat and drink! The renovation is beautiful-very clean as well. Kudos to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Many small issues made for an incredibly frustrating stay”
Reviews.Author: jstjohnz
Reviews.Content: As I write this it is 5:30 AM and I am waiting, for the 2nd time in my 1-nite stay, for a plumber to come to fix the toilet. As a part of their recent remodel, this hotel has installed some ridiculously unreliable high-tech water-saving toilets. Well, they save water all right, because they just randomly refuse to flush, until "reset" in some fashion by the maintenance man. Unfortunately there is no maintenance man on site until 6AM, so here we wait. 6:10 AM, the toilet is fixed for the 2nd time. Apparently the problems with these toilets are widespread and they deal with 30+ calls like this per night, and they are thinking about replacing these toilets with something more reliable. Ya think? Other issues. Couldn't get room lock to work, key worked, handle turned, but wouldn't unlock. Phantom ice machines, signs say on every floor, after much hall-walking (not easy for me due to a disability) I found no icemaker on 3rd floor, out of service on 2nd floor, finally went to desk and was informed that only ice on floors 4,6,8, and 10. Update: last toilet fix was good for 1 flush, now I'm going to call desk for another room. This is the most horrible hotel stay that I can recall in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and superior service”
Reviews.Author: cheermom03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn LAX for a 3 day conference that was held there. The lobby was lovely and I was able to get an early check in. They have a true concierge who helped answer many questions about the area for me. I stayed in a King room and the bed was new and very very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and fully remodeled. Carpet in room was clean enough to walk around without shoes on. Air conditioner worked almost too good and desk was large and convenient. I cant say enough about the staff and management at this hotel. Everyone from the general manager to food and beverage personnel were friendly and accommodating. The food we were served daily was very tasty and elegantly presented. The meeting rooms have been remodeled and were very nice. The pool was one of the best parts of this hotel. It was clean and there is a large privacy wall around it so you felt very safe and private. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on business or even for a family traveling to see the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: pochothepilot
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking in June, I was aware of the fact that this hotel was under renovations. Upon our arrival in July, we were pleasantly surprised to see the entire hotel pretty much done with the remodel. Everything looked brand new and spotless. There were four check-in stations and only two were staffed. Nonetheless, check-in went by fairly quickly. However, the gentleman who checked us in looked tired and did not seem very friendly. He sighed a few times and when he talked he just mumbled. Oh well. He gave us two key cards for our room on the 11th floor. The elevators worked efficiently and looked new. We noticed our room was right next to the elevators. Darn! It didn't bother us too much since our fan from home would drown out the noise at night. The room and bathroom was spotless, and again, it looked brand new. It should look brand new since they changed everything inside and out with the renovation. New furniture, new TV, new carpet, beds, windows, walls, doors, etc. Our view faced north (away from Century Blvd). We could see planes on short final for runways 24R/L, but the noise was non-existant. Overall, for the rate of $59 plus tax we paid for the night, it was a great value. The room was comfortable with a brand new flat screen 32" TV and free wireless internet. The bathroom was large and clean. Normally parking is $12, but we lucked out and got free parking because the controlled access gates were "broken" that day! All in all nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience, due to being renovated”
Reviews.Author: DevilWomanUtah
Reviews.Content: I had prepaid for our room to receive a better rate, however we left one night early and just ended up having to pay for a third night that we didnt up staying in The hotel is under complete renovation. There was scaffolding going up the side of the building for renovation puroposes, our room was looking at that view. Except the window had been tried to be covered with plastic to protect it. There was a tear in that plastic and a piece of cement was stuck to it, that meant the the little bit of wind that was blowing would blow the plastic wrap with cement on it into our window and make a loud "ting" noise. Tried to deal with it for five or ten minutes but it was too loud and annoying. We called the front desk and told them, they prompltly came up to our room with keys to another room with that problem. That room was nice, liked to high speed internet, but shower water wouldnt stay warm. At least three different times the water turned cold during a shower. The pool and fitness room were not availble during our stay either, and only part of the covered parking was open because they were storing construction supplies. I was kinda scared my car would get broke into due to the looks of the area as well. There was also lots of construction workers everywhere, even in our hallway right next you our room working and painting. Was pretty noisey. Would not stay here again. Dont subject yourself to ruining your trip by staying here at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great room great sleep”
Reviews.Author: KCCakes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on business this past week as I had an early morning flight. I knew that the hotel was under renovation but was surprised that it is almost complete. The room that I stayed in was quite large with a great king size bed and 4 different types of pillows to select. It was very quiet and I slept quite soundly especially considering that you are right at the airport. The staff was warm and pleasant. The dining was surprising good given the temporary restaurant set up. The soup was warm and hearty and welcoming after a long trip. The hotel is great now. I can't wait to stay there on my next visit to see how the renovations finished up. I understand that it will be done by the 15th of next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great Layover Hotel with Spacious Clean, Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sdalias
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on May 30 for one night. Checked in late and managed to get a fabulous rate. Although the hotel is undergoing renovation, we stayed in a newly remodeled room. Shower was big and hot. Bathroom was spotless. Room decor was nice and room was quiet and spacious (ask for a room not facing the main street). The bed had down pillows and we asked housekeeping to bring us some non-down pillows and they obliged. Hotel is in a decent location from the airport and the courtesy shuttle comes often. We would definitely stay here again especially if we get if for less than $80 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but still under construction”
Reviews.Author: B707
Reviews.Content: It was a nice clean stay the roomservice was prompt and the desk stuff was very helpfull i had a new renovatet Room clean and nice the only think is now you canÂ´t open the window and when i was there the window was covert with plastic because of the construction so you canÂ´t look out ! I had free parking during my stay because of the construction when there are finisht with this it will be a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay, Newly Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Babelow
Reviews.Content: I had to catch an early flight so it made sense to stay at the airport. Yes I was warned about hotel renovation, however the 12th floor seemed finished and there is no noise at 5PM. My room was new, fresh, and very comfortable. The temporary dining room was pleasant and the staff very efficient. Food was pretty good for hotel fare. Free internet was available.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Under Construction, not notified at booking and they didn't care”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2008, after a long flight from London. My choice was between an executive room at this hotel or a standard room at the LAX Crowne Plaza for the same money. I chose this hotel for the added comfort the executive room would provide, but was sorely disappointed. When I booked in advance there was no notification on the website that construction work was taking place at the hotel and they happily charged me the extra over the cost of a standard room for an executive room. On arrival it was clear construction was taking place, we were then placed in an very old, tired room on a low floor, with scaffolding right outside the window. It was late and we'd had a long flight, so we just tried to get some sleep. But when construction work started in the early hours of the morning this was nye on impossible. On checkout I complained and was told that there were no executive rooms in the hotel during construction, all rooms were the sam3 - so why did they let me pay the extra for one?! I was told nothing could be done as I had paid in advance and I would need to contact the hotel manger directly. When I returned home I contacted the hotel and received no response, I then contacted IC Hotel Group and got no response. I followed up again and finally got a response, they requested the hotel contact me on a number of occasions, but they have still failed to do so. I appears they do not care! I have exchanged various emails with HI Customer Care in the US, but they seem to have their hands tied in terms of resolving any issues, and the best they would offer me was 4000 priority club points. Is it too much to ask for a refund of the extra I paid for the executive room and an apology?!

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke - Hotels under construction shouldn't work at night”
Reviews.Author: UncleDuke
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and was unimpressed. As a priority club platinum member I stay at a lot of Holiday Inn locaitons. This one should be a Ramada Inn. I won't make the same mistake again. First of all the entire lobby was under full blown construction when I checked in. The check in desk was a makeshift desk. They didn't even have the key card machine out at the "check in" desk". When I got into my room it seemed sparse. Then I realized that the room didn't have a desk. The ironic thing is that there was a nice, executive style desk chair yet no desk??? I then noticed that I only had one packet of the individual style coffee. I did call down and request another and they quickly sent another up. I went to bed at 8:30 p.m. local time (I had to wake up very early for a flight) and I kept hearing a knocking. I called down to the "front desk" again and asked if there was still construction going on. She said, "yes, but it's just here in the lobby. You shouldn't be able to be hear it in your room." Apparently they hadn't considered the sound traveling up the outside walls. I will say that once I called the noise stopped. However what think tank brain surgeons schedule construction in the evening, in a hotel????!!!!! The topper was in the morning I noticed when heading to the shower that there were zero wash cloths in the bathroom. I realize hotels must update and construction must go on but they should have notified me at the time of my reservation that the hotel was under MAJOR construction. When a hotel is under construction it may be a good idea to halt construction at dusk! I won't be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport/super hotel”
Reviews.Author: queen15
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Holiday Inn. We had traveled for a week, cross-country from NW Georgia, and booked a hotel while en route. We found our booked hotel not what it advertised to be and in a bad section of town, so we canceled and traveled up the street to the Holiday Inn. The people at Holiday Inn were so welcoming and helpful. Although it was crowded, we were helped right away and check-in was a breeze! The hotel is very beautiful on the inside and the staff is friendly. We also stayed for two nights to do some sightseeing. The concierge was extremely helpful booking a Hollywood tour and a private car to transport us to a LA Dodgers game (which took us right up to the front gate and picked us up there as well!!). There was also a free shuttle that took us to the airport on the day our flight left for Honolulu. This hotel had excellent service, and we will definitely stay there again when we fly out of LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel for your Money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetohio
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! While the rates are very cheap, you will not have a nice stay while this hotel is under deep construction. The entire lobby looks like a war zone with loose wires and ceiling tiles falling everywhere. The elevators got stuck, the pool is drained, there is no restaurant and you will be awoken by hammering by 7:30AM. My room was nice enough at least, but it had minor inconveniences of only cold water available for the shower and no remote for the TV. In addition, my room had no 'Do Not Disturb' sign available and the housekeeping came in my room at 8AM. Luckily I had already woken up to the hammering by the construction workers outside my window. Really this place was AWEFUL! I recommend waiting until they finish construction before staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frla1
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly nice hotel, near LAX. It's cheap and the locaton is great, only 5 min from Los Angeles International Airport. Great if you have a late arrival or early departure and need to be close to the airport. The aircondition is a bit noicy, but can easily survive without it for a night as long as you are not there in the middle of the summer. There's an icemachine outside that comes in handy, also a burritoshop just across the street, with fairly good burritos, if you wanna experience Mexican food when you're in the city of Angels. Also close to Randy's dougnuts if you want one of those, even thouh you get one for breakfast at the hotel. Overall, thumbs up for this cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, If you are Spider Man”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: So, Here's the deal. I've been using Priceline to book hotels on line at discounted rates. As cool as it is to get 3 and 4 star hotels for peanuts, there are several negatives about it. The major issue if you want Mister Shatner to Chop your fees is that you dont get to know what hotel you are staying in until AFTER you pay for it! My experience at the Holiday Inn was terrible. As I approached the hotel, I shocked to see the whole building covered with scaffolding. I tried my harded, I really did, not to let the ugliness of the hotel bother me. The check in clerk was very nice and set me up with a room facing away from Century Boulevard's noise, facing the back of the hotel, where my car was parked. The hallways were very dated, you know the pastel early 80's pink and mint green. Massive holes in the walls, dirty carpet and empty fire extinguisher holders!!! I was praying to the Holiday Inn gods that I wasnt going to spontaneously combust in the middle of the night. The room was also dated and had a faint smell of cigarettes dispite being a non-smoking room. The bed was so-so, the towels were scratchy and being stuck in a room next to the vending machines and ice machine didnt help my evening either. It was also a windy night, and the scaffolding was awaying more and the buns on J-Lo. Around 2am, I got hungry and decided that Taco Bell sounded like a good snack. That was the last time my car was in one peice. While loading my luggage into my SUV, I noticed something different. My third row seat was GONE! I walked over to the driver side and noticed that the thieves had drilled a hole under my door handle and opened the back. I immediately informed the head of hotel security, hoping that the security cameras had seen something. Oh, but wait...the hotel would need to have cameras to be able to catch something like that. That's right, NO SECURITY CAMERAS! My overall experience bad. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “It is greedy to rent rooms to silly customers during building a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: Last night we spent in the Holiday Inn LAX. Our sleep stopped exactly at 7.00 a.m.when a crew of skilled housebuilder used all their eqipment at once (drillers, fixing guns, electrical saws) right in front of our room at the11 th floor (the hotel is completely scaffoled). We came from Guam / Hawaii and wished to sleep a little longer (Hawai is 2 hours earlier than LAX). Do not get fooled by the receptionist which will ask you during check-in if you accept the noise which we did. Of course they used this as an argument against me the next morning when I complained about the noise. Frivolous! It is greedy to rent rooms to silly customers while (re-) building a hotel. Furthermore, we got a wake up call which we never booked and the sink of the bathroom was blocked. There a many other hotels around which are not being built.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MOinkslinger
Reviews.Content: The hotel in under major renovation with scaffolding surrounding the building. The price of $85 per night was cheap enough for a party of three adults. Most of the other hotels wanted additional fees for the third party, but not at the Holiday Inn. Free parking at the location plus a shuttle to the airport that runs every 15 to 20 minutes. Would recommend to anyone needing a layover at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for the dirt.”
Reviews.Author: PAtravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to be close to LAX, which it is. It is still undergoing refurbishment (looks more like reconstruction) of the top several floors. Our room was on the 5th floor. Check-in was fine, we were warned about the noise from the refurb work, it apparently goes from 7AM to 7PM, but there was no sign of it when we checked in on Sat or on Sun. However, there was a huge amount of noise from the road being resurfaced below our room - this has nothing to do with the hotel directly, but it started at 2AM and went on thru the night. We checked several times to see if the window was open because it sounded like there was nothing between us and the construction. In fact, the windows are locked with a key and cannot be opened. We were also warned that due to the refurbishment, there was no coffee in the room. Actually, there was a coffee maker and coffee, the only thing missing was the cups. We could not figure out how this relates to the refurb. Free coffee was made available downstairs instead. From our point of view, the worst part of the stay was that everything is dirty. Even though the 5th floor is not under construction, the hallway carpets are filthy and ill-fitted, the hallways are very dim (to hide the dirt?), the room was OK except that there were numerous hairs lying around. The shower did not work properly - set the temperature and after a minute it goes straight to cold, yikes! The room decor is old and tired and not very clean, presumably the refurb will eventually extend to all floors... The restaurant food was OK, but many of the dishes were not clean. There's no excuse for serving food on dirty plates. Also, there was a sign up advertising happy hour 5-8PM, so we had a couple of beers, only to find out that the happy hour only applies to M-F, not to Saturday. That info was not on the sign, we asked about it, but there was no offer to provide a discount from their own poor communication. If happy hour is not available on the day, the sign should be removed on that day. The impression is that many of the people working here are not very bright. Most of the staff, however, were keeping up the positive appearances and were very helpful. We would recommend not staying at this hotel at least until the refurb is finished, the hope is that the improved hotel will spread to the rest of its operations. The only thing going for it is that it's a good price and convenient to the airport (also a free shuttle), but staying here cannot be described as a positive experience at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you really need a cheap IHC option and an airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: chasingtheskies
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Holiday Inn LAX frequently and for a couple reasons: it's rates and access for the airport. That's it. If you want to book a hotel due to the same factors but with nicer facilities and aren't bound by frequent stay programs, I would otherwise suggest the Four Points LAX (another area hotel I stay frequently). Check-in over my various stays have been a mixed bag. However, in my experience, they've been efficient in processing me through and on my way to the room in no time. As mentioned, the hallways are rather depressing and the rooms could definitely use a bit more TLC (thank goodness for the renovations going on, it's sorely needed!). There is complimentary wireless internet but it can be slow during peak hours! The restaurant itself is alright. I decided to try out their constantly advertised prime rib and thought it was decent. Indeed there is a McDonalds right in front of the hotel as well as a couple gas stations in the Century/La Cienega intersection and an internet cafe and Subway across the street. All in all, if it wasn't for the fact that I'm trying to get Priority Club Platinum status, I wouldn't be staying in this hotel...at least until they finish up with the renovations. Until then, there are other, better options with similar rates in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, but otherwise bad location”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1Traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel on main strip close to airport (almost with all the other major chains), so it is convenient if you have an early morning flight. Property was being renovated when I stayed there in September and it badly needs it. If you came on shuttle bus or cab there is basically no place to walk except the McDonalds in the parking lot. Rooms small and not particularly new but they seem to be updating. Rooms were clean enough and staff at front desk fine. Some of the other nearby hotels looked nicer to me and had a bit more property around them - this is is basically jammed into a tiny spot behind another hotel and the McDonalds. Acceptable for a good nights sleep for early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Needs help”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: i can forgive the reufbishement - even if the work starts at 7am. I can forgive the fact that the top 3 floors of the hotel are open to the elements during the refurb. I can forgive the fact that the room might have done with a deeper clean- it was okay, But the staff are so sullen its unbelieveable. The management really needs to sort this out. Free shuttle to the airport - very handy. Dont use the concierge for anything. they will rip you off. We priced various trips - they wanted 100 dollars for Universal Studios (50 dollars for the bus???? or 45 dollars for the Getty - when its free. Figure out other ways to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Saddest Holiday Inn but OK for a night”
Reviews.Author: MarieK2.
Reviews.Content: We are Priority Club Members so booked this without making any comparisons with others in the area. Arrived very late and slept well in the beds which are new - so they say. It is a very tired and sad Holiday Inn, with tired staff who do not put themselves out in any way. Having said that they are all polite, the rooms are clean and the showers are hot. Acceptable for a quick overnight but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Alittler
Reviews.Content: Paid for one night in advance. When we saw it, we left asap. Communal areas and rooms dirty, staff unhelpful. We were glad to pay and leave. We couldn't have used the beds. Not the experience you need after a long flight. Truly terrible. The place needs a major face lift and a general staff shake-up. Not worthy of the name of a Holiday Inn. Went to the Marriott - far better.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mad_scotty_dog
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last stop on our California holiday, and was the one real disappointment. It is not the easiest hotel to access, given all the barriers, and check in was slow, despite being a priority club member. My wife picked up a luggage cart from the lobby, only to have it taken from her as "this one is for staff only to use" and we were given a much older, poorly maintained one instead. The room was a real poor show - two double beds, only one chair (three of us in the room) and a rather basic bathroom. the room was clean, but the whole place looks in need of a complete revamp. The corridors had strange stains on the carpet and a rug was ripped. Also the access to the pool is odd - the signs guide you through the parking garage and various stairwells, when in fact it is just a little to the left of the main entrance (very odd and off puting). This is by far the poorest Holiday Inn I have stayed in - indeed the holiday inn expresses we stayed in this holiday were better. The only saving grace was breakfast, which whilst pricey (and no "kids eat free"), was good. Internet worked OK as did the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, value for money”
Reviews.Author: tigger2594
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Australia for a few days before traveling on to Mexico. Searched hotels near airport and then used Trip Advisor to narrow down the choices. Hotel is value for money. I booked using the hotel website, prepaid and received a better rate at $80 per night for a standard room with 2 double beds. Beds are comfortable, reasonable amount of room, hot shower. Overall room is a little tired however perfectly acceptable considering the rate paid. Staff have been very helpful providing useful ideas. I have used the tour desk. Quick and offer alternatives if they see a need. Gym is open 24 hours which came in helpful when I awoke at 3am local time. Restaurant is reasonable however Dennys is a 5 minute walk along with McDonalds and Subway across the street. Hotel has a free shuttle every 15 minutes which is helpful. Overall you get what you pay for, a comfortable older hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: paperkiwi84
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this hotel for some training held directly at the property. Was incredibly unimpressed with the staff including the management. Was expecting to be treated with respect and received everything but that! The room was run down and there was "hair" all over the bathroom and the carpeting had cigarette burns all over, I wouldn't walk on the floor without shoes on. The window failed to close tightly so there was a half inch gap between the outside and my room. Not willing to deal with the crabby and rude front desk staff I just dealt with it and kept the blinds closed. When looking for something to do in the area I consulted the concierge (if you could call him that) and he proceeded to answer the phone and carry on a conversation with someone,not regarding business, while I was standing there waiting for an answer. As far as the food goes, don't waste you time! I have never had food that horrible, I was happier going to McDonalds...which I would never consider good food. Out of 3 meals delivered to my room I was hungry after every one and hardly ate any of it. I'm sure for someone who is just staying one night this would be an acceptable property but I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for 12 Hours, But Not Longer”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Holiday Inn LAX, for an overnight after coming from SE Asia, where I live, and before proceeding on to a US city the next morning. The hotel serves its purpose: good and fast (under 15 minutes) shuttle service to and from LAX, fast check-in and check-out, and a friendly and efficient front-desk staff. The hotel itself is worn and shabby, but clean. The rooms are of an adequate size and have sufficient amenities for an overnight. However, the rooms and the hotel's common areas and worn and faded. The entire place needs refurbishing. In all, it is an okay place for a quick overnight stay, but I would look for some place else in the neighborhood (and there are several) if I were going to stay for more than 12 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Tiny King Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: glumball
Reviews.Content: Lured by the promise of INCLUDES VIEW FREE HIGH SPEED INTERNET UPGRADED AMENITIES NEW BED WORK AREA WITH LAMP RELAXATION CHAIR WITH OTTOMAN I booked two nights in a King Executive Room and received confirmation of a booking into a room with these facilities. The 11th floor room allocated was clean but in need of maintenance. The room was so small that there would have been no space for the relaxation chair and ottoman if it had been provided in accordance with the confirmed booking. The promised view (of the freeway and road below) through the dirty windows was obstructed by a structure affixed to the building across the bottom half of our window. Additionally one of our bedlamps did not work. On questioning the duty manager next morning we were offered a move to another room. This was too late. On arrival I should have been allocated a room that filled the description on our confirmed booking and that matched the expectation of an Executive Room. Thankfully the wireless internet functions so that I can post this review from the room described.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: welshtrucker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a wonderful two weeks touring around western USA, until our last night when we stayed at the Holiday Inn. Not impressed the corridors stank of cigarette smoke and the room was just as bad,had to phone up for some air freshner. The room itself wasn't too bad but as non smokers it was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “good stopover”
Reviews.Author: greenbank54
Reviews.Content: Excellent for a stopover if passing through LA. Free shuttle from airport, comfortable room, very friendly and helpful staff. Didn't have dinner but restaurant was excellent for breakfast and reasonably priced. Area not very inviting so wouldn't recommend for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for lay-over at LAX.”
Reviews.Author: TripleDutch
Reviews.Content: On our trip from Amsterdam to Rarotonga, we prefered to make a stop over at LAX rather than continue straight away, especially for our 4 year old daughter. The shuttle to the hotel was convenient. The hotel itself is in a typical airport neighbourhood, nothing special. The room was spacious and clean, however it looked a little bit tired. Although the freeway is nearby (good for acces to LA), we didn't have any trouble with the noise. For a quick bite there is a McDonald's outside. The Holiday Inn serves it purpose for a lay-over; next time however we will try to find a more modern hotel in this price category.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to break journey”
Reviews.Author: kanga56
Reviews.Content: My sister shared the bedroom with my husband and me, shuttle service was excellent,, from the airport,. We requested for a quiet room, which was clean and the bed very comfortable, for our 5 nights stay, the hotel is a bit old and musty but staff were friendly, & helpful, we organized tours from the hotel, went to Universal Tours & Grand LA tour, lots of fast foods places around the place, a bit far from everything else unless you had friends to take you around, Would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JulesSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Location - close to aiport but not nice area. Rooms - Very tired but clean. Staff - helpful. Parking - hotel charges $12 per day. We stayed here having had good experiences at other Holiday Inns throughout California. It was a decent rate, we paid $119 plus tax and although I wasn't expecting luxury I did expect a decent night sleep which I didn't get. Tip, make sure if you stay here you ask for a room on the other side from the hotel entrance. The noise was terrible at the front of the hotel. If you have your own car, I would stay at the Doubletree, El Segundo instead. Much nicer hotel and area and no noise!

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: J0hnF
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel. It looks old and dirty. The rooms are not that spacious and not quiet. The neighbourhood is not tourists friendly at all. No complaint about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Object_A
Reviews.Content: Stuck in LA for a day between flights, this hotel seemed the best mid-range LAX option. It was surprisingly quiet despite its obvious proximity to the airport and several busy roads and highways. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location is not the best for anything other than the airport, although local buses stop nearby for those of us who like to explore the city between flights. There is free and reasonably fast internet and regular shuttles to the airport that took around 10 minutes. If you're stuck between flights overnight at LAX, this is an excellent, mid-range option.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: sheds29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn LAX as a breakup between our flight from Australia and our further domestic flights in the U.S. Being there for only less than 24 hours, we found the Holiday Inn to be very clean and comfortable. Our room had a King sized bed, large t.v. and an average sized (hotel) bathroom. The Hotel is not far from Hollywood/Beverly Hills and my favourite L.A. place, The Farmer's Market, where we had dinner. The Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. There is a shuttle bus that leaves every 15 minutes to go to the airport, which was very convienant for those who had to catch early planes. There are also a number of 'fast food' resturants around; a 'Denny's"' is close by, and a McDonald's is around 50 metres away from the entrance to the hotel. We found the Holiday Inn to be a very comfortable overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Old Property”
Reviews.Author: henulj-lse
Reviews.Content: We needed a room on our journey home from Hawaii to break up the trip. I found a great rate on the AAA website and since AAA endorsed this property, I went ahead and booked it. It was only a one night stay and just needed a bed to sleep in. This property had a shuttle to and from the airport, which was great! It was no problem catching the shuttle as we got in late on a Sunday evening. The lobby is decent, but the little shop off the lobby was closed when we arrived. There is a McDonalds across the street which our teenagers went to once we settled in. They came back, so I think it was a safe area. The room is something else. It is an old property and they do a good job keeping it clean, but it's hard to do much with something so old. The window was in poor condition. The room was shadowy and I expected to see cockroaches whenever I turned on the lights, though, frankly, I didn't. The bathroom was clean. The bed was not the most comfortable, but for one night it was okay. So, the lowdown is that it is an old property and if you require more than one night's stay, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we visited in LA, room were lovely and clean and spacious, staff were”
Reviews.Author: WinifredWicklow
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we visited in LA, staff were lovely and friendly, would definitely recommend it as it was the cleanest as well. good base from which to explore LA, although near the airport 1-2 miles, no aircraft noise, Nice heated pool although no pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: nznewbie04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn at LAX as we arrived late at night and the thought of travelling all the way to Anaheim that night was horrid. The HI at LAX was okay - advantages were free wireless Internet, and guest laundry, and the staff were lovely. Free water and apples at check-in, plus we had caught the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, with only a 5-10 minute wait until one came along (I think they go every 20 minutes, 24 hours a day). Sad thing was firstly the noice coming from outside - although we were near the airport, recently we stayed at another airport hotel that was silent, so I blame the windows rather than the location! Not only that, but we were placed in a room right beside the elevator and it was horridly loud all night long!! Because it was late I didn't have the energy to make a fuss about it, and to be honest, expected it would cease to work sometime in the night but it didn't. So I advise anyone to request a room away from the elevator - ask for this specifically! We were on the 11th floor and in room 7 - this is located right behind the elevator so if you get given this number, ask for another! But all in all it was okay - noise the only downside really, so if you sleep well, this may not bother you at all, and the staff really were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “"Beware of Park, Stay, and Fly"”
Reviews.Author: bryantbeau
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was okay, but upon returning from my trip to pick up my car, I had a suprise. I had parked in the parking garage and I guess someone decided to use the side of my car as a urinal. Needless to say it ate away at the paint on my car and I now have urine stains on my car! They advertise 24 hour security, but apparently they can't stop people from urinating in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There's got to be better stopover options than this”
Reviews.Author: tell_me_how
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade. The rooms are dowdy and depressing. We requested a non-smoking room and were told there weren't any by the rude desk staff. The smoking floor smelt so strongly of stale smoke we couldn't stand it. So we rang the front desk asking if "they were sure there wasn't another non-smoking room availble" and thinking that if they again said "no" we would change to a different hotel. Surprisingly they had many available so they moved us but made no apologies for the wrong information at check-in. The hotel is also miles from anywhere with no resturant options anywhere except mcdonalds next door. Next time we stopover, even for a night, we will stay closer to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holday Inn LAX for a 6-hour lay over in July. It's always hard to choose a hotel for a short layover because even though we'd be asleep most of the time, we'd rather not stay in a short-time hotel. The Holiday Inn airport pick-up bus sometimes also picks up for the nearby Westin Hotel or La Quinta Inn, so you have to look long and hard at the words spelled out by lights on the sign on the front of the bus: they may change in a moment to say, "Holiday Inn." Check-in was adequate, rooms are clean and the service was ok but not energetic. For example, I asked the man at the reception desk standing in front of a sign saying shuttle buses to the airport leave every 15 minutes (on the hour and quarter hour or just whenever the bus arrives?--found out later it's the latter), "We're leaving on a Southwest Airlines domestic flight departing at 7 a.m. What's a good time to leave the hotel?" Answer (with tone of finality): "A bus leaves every 15 minutes." We bought food at the am/pm in the Arco station next door. The "free wireless" is provided by a company that serves more than one hotel, and it was so slow at 1 a.m. that we had to use dial-up to get our day's messages. But considering the high price of rooms near the airport, we would stay at Holiday Inn LAX again.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Naturefreak
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place we stayed during our 8 nights in CA. Only saving grace was the female manager and front desk people. Also, the crib came quickly and there was actually service here as someone did come immediately to help with our luggage (first time all vacation, so he got a nice tip). The place was in a creepy area and the hotel needs updating. Don't know why they haven't done anything about the bathtubs and ceilings. The bed was comfortable enough but there was a lot of outside noise and we were up high (couldn't figure out why we would occasionally hear people "burn out" or traffic noise being that high up (12th floor). Also, the cute old lady on the 800 number gave us a rate of $98 and that's the ONLY reason we stayed here. When we arrived the front desk person tried charging us $125, felt like something dishonest was going on but the female manager fixed it immediately, which was honorable on her part. On the plus side, the shuttle ran like it was supposed to and we arrived at the airport with no problems and stress free. I would ONLY recommend you stay here if you have a very early flight and they give you $100 rate. Not worth more until they update things.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: travelleralamundo
Reviews.Content: Got a free night at this hotel courtesy of a major airline who messed up my connections. Most of the reviews sum it up, nice lobby, close to the airport, the rest of the story....hotel in major need of refurbishment. Well worn hotel rooms yet clean. Restaurant service was pretty good, very responsive and timely with the food. The food was ok, a little pricey but good portions. They automatically add 15% to the bill. Free wireless internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Serres
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice in my last trip to LA. Very nice people, comfortable and cozy room. Worth the money. It is a little bit far for the touristic places in LA, but if you have a car, it is not far. Reccomend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for what it is?????”
Reviews.Author: mamboking
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on Tripadvisor I finally settled for the Holiday Inn as I got a good rate of $78 for one night. having arrived from Australia after 16 hrs flying time and my first trip overseas for 25yrs, and on my own,I needed a 24 hr stopover before continuing onto Toronto. I caught the free shuttle from LAX at 7.00am and only waited 5 minutes and when I arrived at the Holiday Inn I needed my room immediately, and for exactly 24hrs before I checked out. The front desk said I was too early to check and that my room was not available.But the supervisor found me another room as I was checking out at 6.00am the next day. So for me that was good service. The place is i need of updating but the room was clean but no fridge only free ice for the ice bucket. I went to have a shower but could not figure out how to to work the damm single tap thing,one call to housekeeping and they told me how to work it, again prompt service. There is a Macdonald's and car rental right out the front and across the highway there is a good internet cafe that served reasonable meals. Even the local Highway Patrol officers eat there. If you are looking for a quick stopover in LA then the Holiday Inn is fine

Reviews.Title: “Not special”
Reviews.Author: Live2Explore
Reviews.Content: it was just an average experience for me. Though the hotel exterior and lobby look pretty nice, the room and hallway smell 'old'. The place certainly didn't feel like a 3-stars hotel. On top of that, you have to pay $12 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends in February 2006 for 2 nights. We didn't want to base ourselves far form the airport before flying home, and this proved perfect. We booked ourselves into an LA bus tour and caught a cab downtown, it was easy to get around from there. There are usually always taxis waiting outside the hotel to take you wherever. The view was pretty crappy, lucky enough we weren't staying there for that! The beds were super-comfy and everything was in good working order. If I need to stay near the airport in LA again, I'll definitely consider this Holiday Inn as an option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: brisbane-chick
Reviews.Content: After reading almost every review on this hotel my brother and I decided to stay here because it was cheap and appeared to be central to the airport and most tourist attractions. We stayed at the hotel for 3 weeks and had a fantastic time. Check in was fast and the free shuttle service from the airport was great â€“ saved a lot of hassle with bags. During our stay we did about 7 tours â€“ all of which were booked directly through the concierge. They were outstanding at their job and always made sure we were happy and never got ripped off. When we needed taxis they were very prompt also and one particular man Joe went out of his way to greet and talk to us almost every day. The room itself was also great â€“ it was modern and homely with very comfy beds, large tv with clear reception, very hot water, nice fresh towels and clean facilities. The house keeping ladies were lovely too â€“ often stopping for a quick hello in the hall and a friendly smile too!! Because we stayed here so long we got to know the ins and outs of the hotel and the staff were extremely nice to us. This hotel is in a handy location for people wanting to see Hollywood, Universal Studios and other local attractions with most of them only being around 15-20 mins away. There is also a McDonalds, Subway, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell within walking distance of the hotel and Pizza Hut can even deliver to your room (we did this several times). I would not recommend venturing out at night past 12pm â€“ we did this twice and got hounded by homeless people outside McDonalds. If take-away food isnâ€™t your thing, the room service is fantastic â€“ we ate it almost every day and the menu offered a wide variety of foods at very good prices.
