Average meal for 2 with drinks and tips was around $35-$45 US. Probably not cheap for families though. We loved the roast beef sandwiches Overall there is nothing bad I can say about this hotel. I would definitely stay there again and I would highly recommend the hotel for families and people on a budget. The staff were great, the food was great, the location was fantastic and the overall experience was 9 out of 10 If you are looking for a 5 star hotel this is not your place. However, if youâ€™re looking for somewhere warm, friendly and close to tourist attractions then you will feel right at home at the Holiday Inn LAX. p.s they also have a really handy little store inside to buy sundries and snacks D Graehlert, Brisbane, QLD, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights; you get pretty much what you would expect from a central Holiday Inn. Decent room, excellent location (for access to LAX); good beds; reasonable price. Not a dangerous area; I walked along Century Blvd for 30 minutes after returning my rental and it was more than fine. No worthy restaurants or attractions nearby. Charges $11 daily for parking. I got mis-charged $15 for a movie I didn't watch, but had no trouble having it reversed. I would not hesitate to stay here again under similar circumstances; however, I would not stay here as a vacation focal point since one can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifying”
Reviews.Author: Laurasara
Reviews.Content: My room number was given to a man that I did not know. But, I did see the man check into the hotel after me. The man called my room at your hotel and asked me "if I wanted company for the evening?" He told me that he was staying in a room on the top floor of your hotel. As a single woman traveling alone, I found the experience threatening and offensive. The room smelled as if rented by the hour, not the night. The drapes were partially hung. The air conditioning unit was noisy and sounded as if it was breaking down. The appearance of the hotel room was drab and cheap. I also had to hire a cab to take me to the hotel because the shuttle service advertised on the Internet did not materialize. This is the same note I wrote to the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Couple of Nights”
Reviews.Author: Ariana&Sam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights before flying onto our next destination. It's close to the airport which is good if you are not staying long. they have a free airport shuttle service that leaves every 15mins. The concierge is very helpful and there are many guided tours that depart from the hotel. We did the LA city tour which showed all the main sites. it's a bit hard to get to those places on your own. We were here 5yrs ago and they have made improvements since then. The rooms were clean, nice bed and room service was good. Only downside is that there is no bar fridge in the room, just ice and vending machine down the hall. Would highly recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocs1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one mile from the airport I stayed here for 2 nights, at the end of my trip - the hotel staff were very helpful in offering to arrange a tour of LA for me on my last day before flying home The rooms are nice, clean, and surprisingly quiet considering its location to the road and the airport. though we did change rooms as the first one was slighlty noiser the only downside was the restaurant. i ate there on last night as had an early start the next morning and no where else nearby really. the food was dreadful and inedible. andthe restaurant manager was not very professional or aware of what good customer service is! but woudl recommend this hotel neverless

Reviews.Title: “Old and Smells”
Reviews.Author: Bigcha
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in LAX overnight due to flight delays and were given a "voucher" from the airline for this hotel. $99 airline "deal" for a hotel I wouldn't have spent $30 on. It seemed like they cleaned, but the place is old and outdated, smelled, there weren't any extras in the room, and we had to deal with sirens all night.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff good hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefamilycoops
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights early april, we could not get hotel in vegas the staff were very good the rooms clean just an all round good hotel would not hesitate to stay again. not the best area but felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Apr 14, for an early morning flight the next day. I found the place to be quite nice. The rooms were large and everything was fresh and clean. The resturant was great and they even have snacks at happy hour. I would stay here again if I were flying out of LAX, but you wouldn't pick this location for anything else, of coarse.We needed the shuttle bus for 3:30 am and he was right there ready to take us.

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice, the rest horrible”
Reviews.Author: Livinginspain
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice. It is close to the airport. But the rooms are worse than most cheap motels I have stayed in: cracked and old bathroom tiles, water-stained walls, stinky rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night courtesy of Northwest when we gave up our plane seats. This hotel is great. They offer a free shuttle every 20 minutes to the airport. They rooms are spotless. The pool was nice, but it was too cold to swim. Staff was super-nice and helpful. By far, the best part of this hotel was the restaurant on the lobby-level. This food was fantastic. I had rosemary chicken and my husband had the prime rib. We both agree it was the best food we had on our whole vacation. So, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: maugrim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 2 occasions and think that its a good, reasonably priced hotel close to LAX. 1. The shuttles were quick and reliable 2. The staff were friendly 3. The beds were very comfortable However, on my first night, I was in a room next to the elevator shaft on the top floor, which was VERY noisy and made the jet lag hard to shake off. The environment is not nearly as 'dangerous' as some have suggested, its LA and its in a non descript area. The Westin and other chains are very close as is the Thrifty rental office which is in walking distance. Again, very good value and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie715
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my one night stay at this hotel. Check in was fast. The room was in excellent condition. It included a sofa and cocktail table and nice size desk. The king size bed included 5 pillows. Air conditioning seemed like a new unit and was very easy to control to the temperature I wanted it to be. I liked the touch of the manager calling in the evening (about 7:30pm) to ask if everything was in order and if I needed anything. The only minor thing that happened was that I went to the bar for their Happy Hour and hot hors'dourves but there were no hot hors'dourves. That was a very minor thing. I will book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price.”
Reviews.Author: R0adWarrier
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied. There are bus stops right in front and a McDonalds in the parking lot. There is a free beach shuttle that stops in front. Be sure and request a rooom in the back since the street noise in front is really loud! Definately worth the money and convenient if you aren't renting a car. (The bus service will get you anyhere for $3 a day and the drivers are friendly and helpful.) I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Falcon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as part of a package for the Rose Bowl parade. Reading the reviews I was not happy prior to departure. Fortunately, that changed. Upon arrival at LAX I called the hotel from the baggage claim area and was directed to go out to the proper location for pick-up. You must go to the area with the red sign for hotel transportation. Any other location, the bus may not stop. In 20 minutes the bus arrived and driver assisted with luggage. It was a short ride to the hotel. Check-in was fast, efficient and pleasant. Being a Priority Club member (joined prior to departure) got me a card for a 5% discount on food and drinks. A coupon for a complimentary drink at the lounge is provided at check-in (one per room â€“ not per person). I requested a room at the back of the building after reading reviews concerning street noise on the front side. I was provided a room on the 8th floor, rear view â€“ the building has 12 floors plus underground and street level parking. I would say that this Holiday Inn was a cut above the usual. I found it to be very clean in all areas from reception area, lounge, restaurant, pool, etc. Also the staff was very friendly and pleasant. The room was large with 3 slider type windows, one opened. Not the best view but far from the worst I have encountered. Actually, in the evening it was a nice view of the city lights. From the lower levels it would not be so great so ask for a room at the top. Street noise was not a problem on this side of the building and at this level. Yes, you can see the planes landing but they are not that close. The room was equipped as you would expect. The furniture was in very good condition with the exception of the couch that was showing some wear. The bed was comfortable. Carpeting was clean and in good condition. An iron and ironing board is in the room. Standard bathroom, very clean but lacked an exhaust fan. Hallway and elevators were very clean and well maintained. The business center was equipped with two computers and a printer. The outdoor heated pool is next to the fitness center. We used our coupon at the lounge and of course opted for a few more! The bar can accommodate about ten persons. The lounge area has about 20 tables and several wall mounted televisions. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant. Previous reviews stated the food was not bad and I would agree. A little, maybe a lot better than you might expect. The restaurant is fairly large and has a buffet area and is very clean. Breakfast buffet is available at $9.95 or you order from the menu. On the first evening an employee delivered two bottles of water with a container of ice. A complimentary copy of USA Today was delivered each morning. Previous comments regarding the location are accurate. For a business traveler I would say this would be an excellent location with proximity to LAX, freeway and parking. A tourist would have to take the location into consideration. While there are no restaurants in close proximity and taxis are fairly expensive, there is a free trolley service from in front of the Clarion Hotel (next to the Holiday Inn) to Manhattan Beach. It makes 8 stops along the route. You can stroll the beach and pier, shopping area, mall and review several good restaurants. This is an excellent service and departs every hour. Pick up the trolley schedule in the hotel lobby. Overall, I was very satisfied with the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Oakhursttraveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the airport. Clean, big rooms, friendly staff. I am not sure what else you need! This is not a hotel for a vacation after all it is a business and stay overnight kind of place for LAX. Hotel restaurant was very good both for dinner and breakfast (Landings) and medium priced. Did not check out pool or fitness center. I am not sure what the complaint was about the shuttle to the airport. It ran every 20 minutes 24 hours a day. Driver courteous and helpful. Desk staff very friendly and helpful. Being just off Century Blvd and the 405 freeway there was a lot of traffic noise all through the night and if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the opposite side. I would expect any hotel near the airport would have the same problem as most are on Century Blvd. Beside the traffice noise, the business center was very expensive to use so there is an internet cafe across the street at much better rates (although crossing Century blvd was hazardous!). For short stay, hotel was very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night during January 2005. There is a free shuttle bus from LAX to the hotel, just ring the hotel from LAX and it will come to pick you up. Likewise, heading back to the airport, the free shuttle bus runs every 10-15 minutes 24 hrs. The hotels itself are average, TV, bathroom, bed. For a one-night stay you can't complain for the price, but I wouldn't recommend basing yourself here for any more than a day. The first room I was assigned to smelt of smoke (despite being on a non-smoking floor), but after seeing the concierge they were able to change me to another room, with no problems. Right within walking distance of the hotel is a drive through Macdonalds (literally metres away from the hotel lobby), and a gas station/convenience store right next to that. Pizza Hut and Taco Bell are down the road. Across the street was an Internet cafe, which closes until quite late, around 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Wasabi
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife spent 1 night in the hotel. As a stopover, I did not expect that it's a great hotel but the hotel certainly exceed my expectations. I booked the room directly with the hotel website. Stayed in an executive non-smoking king bed room on top floor. The hotel staff were friendly. The room started to get old but its clean. I can't smell any smoke at all. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom has all the stuff that you needed including shower gels, soaps etc. There are good TV channels for you to watch in case you cant sleep. There is a scheduled free shuttle bus between the hotel and the airport every 15 minutes and they run on time so you dont need to book it. Check-in and Check-out is easy and simple - 5 minutes and you are done. Overall its a nice hotel to stay - A four star hotel with the price of a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet Holiday Inn standards”
Reviews.Author: MontrealSunseeker
Reviews.Content: We booked this place on a family vacation in California knowing that Holiday Inns usually mean clean, nice and reliable. This hotel was rated a 3 stars, but it felt like a 2 star rundown motel. The rooms were quite small and did not smell very fresh. In addition, the furniture felt rundown and in need of a facelift. In addition the concierge gave me incorrect information when I asked about a particular location. Finally, I tried looking for the pool, but when I saw that I had to go through the laundry-room and garage to get to it, I changed my mind. This place is definitely not up to standards.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck and Double Yuck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel for 1 night before we flew out of LAX. First of all, we bought the motel on Priceline, and when we got to the motel they did not have a double non-smoking room. (there were 3 of us) We ended up trying a smoking room which did not work. We then tried the single ns room. It stunk, and the entire place was filthy. The room smelled almost as bad as the smoking room! Also, when we walked into the motel lobby, there were some kind of little flies swarming around the middle of the room. Iwould never recommend this room to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “An airport hotel. No more. No less.”
Reviews.Author: Noel O
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location when you want to drop off a hire car and catch a plane the next morning. We were on the side away from Century Blvd so traffic noise wasn't a problem and we got to watch lots of planes on final approach to LAX. Rooms were clean but a bit tired and the restaurant was good. Would readily stay here again if flying into or out of LAX and needed an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price and location close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my wife in June 2004. Cost was US$80 (A$118) for a double. It was fine for our requirements as a one night stopover close to the airport on our way to Europe. Room was a decent size and clean. Big bed was comfortable. Bathroom was excellent. Hotel staff were friendly. The free shuttle bus from LAX was handy. We would concur with others who highlighted the traffic noise from Central Boulevard. Keep the door closed and the aircon on. We chose to stay near the airport because we were flying out again the following day, but beware the cost of getting a cab into town - Rodeo Drive, Hollywood Boulevard etc. - it will cost you about US$35 (A$53) during the day and close to US$50 (A$75) at night. And do not use the room phone for international calls. We made 2 four minute calls to Australia that cost us about A$35 each! Hotel is a bit on the tired side, but good for the price if you want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable value for near-airport accommodations”
Reviews.Author: roam-ID
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Seemed like a decent value for the area but don't expect anything above average, just basic clean accommodations with the usual amenities, including in-room coffee. Not a bad place, considering it's in a highly commercial/industrial area. The complimentary shuttle to the airport runs every 20 minutes, which was very convenient. Down-side: street noise; housekeeping staff ignore "do not disturb" sign, knock on the door and barge in mid-afternoon saying "room check" whatever that means; my room was no-smoking on a no-smoking floor but still had an odd smell. Fitness room and pool are oddly located. You have to go out into the garage and re-enter the hotel through another door, which is inconvenient.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Los Angeles International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 9901 La Cienega Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90045
